-- | The identifier of the contact flow.
contactFlow_id :: Lens' ContactFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the contact flow.
contactFlow_name :: Lens' ContactFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | The content of the contact flow.
contactFlow_content :: Lens' ContactFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more tags.
contactFlow_tags :: Lens' ContactFlow (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The description of the contact flow.
contactFlow_description :: Lens' ContactFlow (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the contact flow. For descriptions of the available types,
--   see <a>Choose a Contact Flow Type</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect
--   Administrator Guide</i>.
contactFlow_type :: Lens' ContactFlow (Maybe ContactFlowType)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.ContactFlow.ContactFlow
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.ContactFlow.ContactFlow
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.ContactFlow.ContactFlow
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.ContactFlow.ContactFlow
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.ContactFlow.ContactFlow
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.ContactFlow.ContactFlow
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.ContactFlow.ContactFlow


module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Credentials

-- | Contains credentials to use for federation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCredentials</a> smart constructor.
data Credentials
Credentials' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Credentials

-- | Renews the expiration timer for a generated token.
[$sel:refreshTokenExpiration:Credentials'] :: Credentials -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An access token generated for a federated user to access Amazon
--   Connect.
[$sel:accessToken:Credentials'] :: Credentials -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | A token generated with an expiration time for the session a user is
--   logged in to Amazon Connect.
[$sel:accessTokenExpiration:Credentials'] :: Credentials -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Renews a token generated for a user to access the Amazon Connect
--   instance.
[$sel:refreshToken:Credentials'] :: Credentials -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>Credentials</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshTokenExpiration:Credentials'</a>,
--   <a>credentials_refreshTokenExpiration</a> - Renews the expiration
--   timer for a generated token.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessToken:Credentials'</a>, <a>credentials_accessToken</a> -
--   An access token generated for a federated user to access Amazon
--   Connect.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessTokenExpiration:Credentials'</a>,
--   <a>credentials_accessTokenExpiration</a> - A token generated with an
--   expiration time for the session a user is logged in to Amazon Connect.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshToken:Credentials'</a>, <a>credentials_refreshToken</a>
--   - Renews a token generated for a user to access the Amazon Connect
--   instance.
newCredentials :: Credentials

-- | Renews the expiration timer for a generated token.
credentials_refreshTokenExpiration :: Lens' Credentials (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An access token generated for a federated user to access Amazon
--   Connect.
credentials_accessToken :: Lens' Credentials (Maybe Text)

-- | A token generated with an expiration time for the session a user is
--   logged in to Amazon Connect.
credentials_accessTokenExpiration :: Lens' Credentials (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Renews a token generated for a user to access the Amazon Connect
--   instance.
credentials_refreshToken :: Lens' Credentials (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Credentials.Credentials
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Credentials.Credentials
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Credentials.Credentials
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Credentials.Credentials
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Credentials.Credentials
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Credentials.Credentials

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.EncryptionConfig

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEncryptionConfig</a> smart constructor.
data EncryptionConfig
EncryptionConfig' :: EncryptionType -> Text -> EncryptionConfig

-- | The type of encryption.
[$sel:encryptionType:EncryptionConfig'] :: EncryptionConfig -> EncryptionType

-- | The full ARN of the encryption key.
--   
--   Be sure to provide the full ARN of the encryption key, not just the
--   ID.
[$sel:keyId:EncryptionConfig'] :: EncryptionConfig -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EncryptionConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionType:EncryptionConfig'</a>,
--   <a>encryptionConfig_encryptionType</a> - The type of encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyId:EncryptionConfig'</a>, <a>encryptionConfig_keyId</a> -
--   The full ARN of the encryption key.
--   
--   Be sure to provide the full ARN of the encryption key, not just the
--   ID.
newEncryptionConfig :: EncryptionType -> Text -> EncryptionConfig

-- | The type of encryption.
encryptionConfig_encryptionType :: Lens' EncryptionConfig EncryptionType

-- | The full ARN of the encryption key.
--   
--   Be sure to provide the full ARN of the encryption key, not just the
--   ID.
encryptionConfig_keyId :: Lens' EncryptionConfig Text

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Filters

-- | Contains the filter to apply when retrieving metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFilters</a> smart constructor.
data Filters
Filters' :: Maybe [Channel] -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Filters

-- | The channel to use to filter the metrics.
[$sel:channels:Filters'] :: Filters -> Maybe [Channel]

-- | The queues to use to filter the metrics. You can specify up to 100
--   queues per request.
[$sel:queues:Filters'] :: Filters -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>Filters</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channels:Filters'</a>, <a>filters_channels</a> - The channel
--   to use to filter the metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queues:Filters'</a>, <a>filters_queues</a> - The queues to use
--   to filter the metrics. You can specify up to 100 queues per request.
newFilters :: Filters

-- | The channel to use to filter the metrics.
filters_channels :: Lens' Filters (Maybe [Channel])

-- | The queues to use to filter the metrics. You can specify up to 100
--   queues per request.
filters_queues :: Lens' Filters (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Filters.Filters
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Filters.Filters
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Filters.Filters
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Filters.Filters
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Filters.Filters
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Filters.Filters
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Filters.Filters

--   the hierarchy group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:HierarchyGroupSummary'</a>, <a>hierarchyGroupSummary_id</a>
--   - The identifier of the hierarchy group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:HierarchyGroupSummary'</a>,
--   <a>hierarchyGroupSummary_name</a> - The name of the hierarchy group.
newHierarchyGroupSummary :: HierarchyGroupSummary

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HierarchyPath

-- | Contains information about the levels of a hierarchy group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHierarchyPath</a> smart constructor.
data HierarchyPath

-- | Information about level four.

-- | Information about level five.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   - Information about level three.
--   
--   <a>$sel:levelFour:HierarchyPath'</a>, <a>hierarchyPath_levelFour</a> -
--   Information about level four.
--   
--   <a>$sel:levelFive:HierarchyPath'</a>, <a>hierarchyPath_levelFive</a> -
--   Information about level five.
--   
--   <a>$sel:levelOne:HierarchyPath'</a>, <a>hierarchyPath_levelOne</a> -
--   Information about level one.
--   
--   <a>$sel:levelTwo:HierarchyPath'</a>, <a>hierarchyPath_levelTwo</a> -
--   Information about level two.

-- | Information about level four.
hierarchyPath_levelFour :: Lens' HierarchyPath (Maybe HierarchyGroupSummary)

-- | Information about level five.
hierarchyPath_levelFive :: Lens' HierarchyPath (Maybe HierarchyGroupSummary)

-- | Information about level one.
hierarchyPath_levelOne :: Lens' HierarchyPath (Maybe HierarchyGroupSummary)

-- | Information about level two.
hierarchyPath_levelTwo :: Lens' HierarchyPath (Maybe HierarchyGroupSummary)

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HierarchyPath.HierarchyPath
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HierarchyPath.HierarchyPath

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HierarchyGroup

-- | The identifier of the level in the hierarchy group.

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the hierarchy group.

[$sel:id:HierarchyGroup'] :: HierarchyGroup -> Maybe Text

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HoursOfOperation

-- | Information about of the hours of operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHoursOfOperation</a> smart constructor.
data HoursOfOperation
HoursOfOperation' :: Maybe [HoursOfOperationConfig] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> HoursOfOperation

-- | Configuration information for the hours of operation.
[$sel:config:HoursOfOperation'] :: HoursOfOperation -> Maybe [HoursOfOperationConfig]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the hours of operation.
[$sel:hoursOfOperationArn:HoursOfOperation'] :: HoursOfOperation -> Maybe Text

-- | The name for the hours of operation.
[$sel:name:HoursOfOperation'] :: HoursOfOperation -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:HoursOfOperation'] :: HoursOfOperation -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The description for the hours of operation.
[$sel:description:HoursOfOperation'] :: HoursOfOperation -> Maybe Text

-- | The time zone for the hours of operation.
[$sel:timeZone:HoursOfOperation'] :: HoursOfOperation -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier for the hours of operation.
[$sel:hoursOfOperationId:HoursOfOperation'] :: HoursOfOperation -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HoursOfOperation</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:config:HoursOfOperation'</a>, <a>hoursOfOperation_config</a> -
--   Configuration information for the hours of operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hoursOfOperationArn:HoursOfOperation'</a>,
--   <a>hoursOfOperation_hoursOfOperationArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) for the hours of operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:HoursOfOperation'</a>, <a>hoursOfOperation_name</a> - The
--   name for the hours of operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:HoursOfOperation'</a>, <a>hoursOfOperation_tags</a> - One
--   or more tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:HoursOfOperation'</a>,
--   <a>hoursOfOperation_description</a> - The description for the hours of
--   operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeZone:HoursOfOperation'</a>,
--   <a>hoursOfOperation_timeZone</a> - The time zone for the hours of
--   operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hoursOfOperationId:HoursOfOperation'</a>,
--   <a>hoursOfOperation_hoursOfOperationId</a> - The identifier for the
--   hours of operation.
newHoursOfOperation :: HoursOfOperation

-- | Configuration information for the hours of operation.
hoursOfOperation_config :: Lens' HoursOfOperation (Maybe [HoursOfOperationConfig])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the hours of operation.
hoursOfOperation_hoursOfOperationArn :: Lens' HoursOfOperation (Maybe Text)

-- | The name for the hours of operation.
hoursOfOperation_name :: Lens' HoursOfOperation (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more tags.
hoursOfOperation_tags :: Lens' HoursOfOperation (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The description for the hours of operation.
hoursOfOperation_description :: Lens' HoursOfOperation (Maybe Text)

-- | The time zone for the hours of operation.
hoursOfOperation_timeZone :: Lens' HoursOfOperation (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier for the hours of operation.
hoursOfOperation_hoursOfOperationId :: Lens' HoursOfOperation (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HoursOfOperation.HoursOfOperation
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HoursOfOperation.HoursOfOperation
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HoursOfOperation.HoursOfOperation
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HoursOfOperation.HoursOfOperation

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Attribute

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttribute</a> smart constructor.

-- | The type of attribute.

-- | The value of the attribute.

--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   The type of attribute.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Attribute'</a>, <a>attribute_value</a> - The value of
--   the attribute.
newAttribute :: Attribute

-- | The type of attribute.

-- | The value of the attribute.
attribute_value :: Lens' Attribute (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Instance

-- | The Amazon Connect instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstance</a> smart constructor.
data Instance
Instance' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DirectoryType -> Maybe InstanceStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe InstanceStatusReason -> Instance

-- | The alias of instance.
[$sel:instanceAlias:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The service role of the instance.
[$sel:serviceRole:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether outbound calls are enabled.
[$sel:outboundCallsEnabled:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance.
[$sel:arn:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The identity management type.
[$sel:identityManagementType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe DirectoryType

-- | The state of the instance.
[$sel:instanceStatus:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe InstanceStatus

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:id:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | When the instance was created.
[$sel:createdTime:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Whether inbound calls are enabled.
[$sel:inboundCallsEnabled:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Bool

-- | Relevant details why the instance was not successfully created.
[$sel:statusReason:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe InstanceStatusReason

-- | Create a value of <a>Instance</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceAlias:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_instanceAlias</a> -
--   The alias of instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRole:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_serviceRole</a> - The
--   service role of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outboundCallsEnabled:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_outboundCallsEnabled</a> - Whether outbound calls are
--   enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityManagementType:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_identityManagementType</a> - The identity management type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceStatus:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_instanceStatus</a> -
--   The state of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_id</a> - The identifier of the
--   Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdTime:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_createdTime</a> - When
--   the instance was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inboundCallsEnabled:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_inboundCallsEnabled</a> - Whether inbound calls are
--   enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statusReason:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_statusReason</a> -
--   Relevant details why the instance was not successfully created.
newInstance :: Instance

-- | The alias of instance.
instance_instanceAlias :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The service role of the instance.
instance_serviceRole :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | Whether outbound calls are enabled.
instance_outboundCallsEnabled :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance.
instance_arn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The identity management type.
instance_identityManagementType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe DirectoryType)

-- | The state of the instance.
instance_instanceStatus :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceStatus)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
instance_id :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | When the instance was created.
instance_createdTime :: Lens' Instance (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Whether inbound calls are enabled.
instance_inboundCallsEnabled :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Bool)

-- | Relevant details why the instance was not successfully created.
instance_statusReason :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceStatusReason)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Instance.Instance
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Instance.Instance
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Instance.Instance

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceSummary</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceSummary

-- | The alias of the instance.
[$sel:instanceAlias:InstanceSummary'] :: InstanceSummary -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

[$sel:serviceRole:InstanceSummary'] :: InstanceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Whether outbound calls are enabled.
[$sel:outboundCallsEnabled:InstanceSummary'] :: InstanceSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The identity management type of the instance.
[$sel:identityManagementType:InstanceSummary'] :: InstanceSummary -> Maybe DirectoryType

[$sel:instanceStatus:InstanceSummary'] :: InstanceSummary -> Maybe InstanceStatus

[$sel:createdTime:InstanceSummary'] :: InstanceSummary -> Maybe POSIX

[$sel:inboundCallsEnabled:InstanceSummary'] :: InstanceSummary -> Maybe Bool

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceRole:InstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSummary_serviceRole</a> - The service role of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outboundCallsEnabled:InstanceSummary'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSummary_outboundCallsEnabled</a> - Whether outbound calls
--   are enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:InstanceSummary'</a>, <a>instanceSummary_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance.

--   management type of the instance.
--

--   <a>instanceSummary_instanceStatus</a> - The state of the instance.

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.KinesisVideoStreamConfig

-- | Configuration information of a Kinesis video stream.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKinesisVideoStreamConfig</a> smart constructor.
data KinesisVideoStreamConfig
KinesisVideoStreamConfig' :: Text -> Natural -> EncryptionConfig -> KinesisVideoStreamConfig

-- | The prefix of the video stream.
[$sel:prefix:KinesisVideoStreamConfig'] :: KinesisVideoStreamConfig -> Text

-- | The number of hours data is retained in the stream. Kinesis Video
--   Streams retains the data in a data store that is associated with the
--   stream.
--   
--   The default value is 0, indicating that the stream does not persist
--   data.
[$sel:retentionPeriodHours:KinesisVideoStreamConfig'] :: KinesisVideoStreamConfig -> Natural

-- | The encryption configuration.
[$sel:encryptionConfig:KinesisVideoStreamConfig'] :: KinesisVideoStreamConfig -> EncryptionConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>KinesisVideoStreamConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:prefix:KinesisVideoStreamConfig'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisVideoStreamConfig_prefix</a> - The prefix of the video
--   stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:retentionPeriodHours:KinesisVideoStreamConfig'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisVideoStreamConfig_retentionPeriodHours</a> - The number of
--   hours data is retained in the stream. Kinesis Video Streams retains
--   the data in a data store that is associated with the stream.
--   
--   The default value is 0, indicating that the stream does not persist
--   data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfig:KinesisVideoStreamConfig'</a>,
--   <a>kinesisVideoStreamConfig_encryptionConfig</a> - The encryption
--   configuration.
newKinesisVideoStreamConfig :: Text -> Natural -> EncryptionConfig -> KinesisVideoStreamConfig

-- | The prefix of the video stream.
kinesisVideoStreamConfig_prefix :: Lens' KinesisVideoStreamConfig Text

-- | The number of hours data is retained in the stream. Kinesis Video
--   Streams retains the data in a data store that is associated with the
--   stream.
--   
--   The default value is 0, indicating that the stream does not persist
--   data.
kinesisVideoStreamConfig_retentionPeriodHours :: Lens' KinesisVideoStreamConfig Natural

-- | The encryption configuration.
kinesisVideoStreamConfig_encryptionConfig :: Lens' KinesisVideoStreamConfig EncryptionConfig
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.KinesisVideoStreamConfig.KinesisVideoStreamConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.KinesisVideoStreamConfig.KinesisVideoStreamConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.KinesisVideoStreamConfig.KinesisVideoStreamConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.KinesisVideoStreamConfig.KinesisVideoStreamConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.KinesisVideoStreamConfig.KinesisVideoStreamConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.KinesisVideoStreamConfig.KinesisVideoStreamConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.KinesisVideoStreamConfig.KinesisVideoStreamConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.KinesisVideoStreamConfig.KinesisVideoStreamConfig


module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.LexBot

-- | Configuration information of an Amazon Lex bot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLexBot</a> smart constructor.
data LexBot
LexBot' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> LexBot

-- | The name of the Amazon Lex bot.
[$sel:name:LexBot'] :: LexBot -> Maybe Text

-- | The Region that the Amazon Lex bot was created in.
[$sel:lexRegion:LexBot'] :: LexBot -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LexBot</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LexBot'</a>, <a>lexBot_name</a> - The name of the Amazon
--   Lex bot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lexRegion:LexBot'</a>, <a>lexBot_lexRegion</a> - The Region
--   that the Amazon Lex bot was created in.
newLexBot :: LexBot

-- | The name of the Amazon Lex bot.
lexBot_name :: Lens' LexBot (Maybe Text)

-- | The Region that the Amazon Lex bot was created in.
lexBot_lexRegion :: Lens' LexBot (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.LexBot.LexBot
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.LexBot.LexBot
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.LexBot.LexBot
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.LexBot.LexBot
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.LexBot.LexBot
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.LexBot.LexBot
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.LexBot.LexBot
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.LexBot.LexBot

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.LexBotConfig

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lexV2Bot:LexBotConfig'</a>, <a>lexBotConfig_lexV2Bot</a> -
--   Configuration information of an Amazon Lex V2 bot.
newLexBotConfig :: LexBotConfig

-- | Undocumented member.
lexBotConfig_lexBot :: Lens' LexBotConfig (Maybe LexBot)

-- | Configuration information of an Amazon Lex V2 bot.
lexBotConfig_lexV2Bot :: Lens' LexBotConfig (Maybe LexV2Bot)

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.MediaConcurrency

-- | Contains information about which channels are supported, and how many
--   contacts an agent can have on a channel simultaneously.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMediaConcurrency</a> smart constructor.
data MediaConcurrency
MediaConcurrency' :: Channel -> Natural -> MediaConcurrency

-- | The channels that agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel
--   (CCP).
[$sel:channel:MediaConcurrency'] :: MediaConcurrency -> Channel

-- | The number of contacts an agent can have on a channel simultaneously.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>VOICE</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   1.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>CHAT</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>TASK</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
[$sel:concurrency:MediaConcurrency'] :: MediaConcurrency -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>MediaConcurrency</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channel:MediaConcurrency'</a>, <a>mediaConcurrency_channel</a>
--   - The channels that agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel
--   (CCP).
--   
--   <a>$sel:concurrency:MediaConcurrency'</a>,
--   <a>mediaConcurrency_concurrency</a> - The number of contacts an agent
--   can have on a channel simultaneously.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>VOICE</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   1.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>CHAT</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>TASK</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
newMediaConcurrency :: Channel -> Natural -> MediaConcurrency

-- | The channels that agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel
--   (CCP).
mediaConcurrency_channel :: Lens' MediaConcurrency Channel

-- | The number of contacts an agent can have on a channel simultaneously.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>VOICE</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   1.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>CHAT</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>TASK</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
mediaConcurrency_concurrency :: Lens' MediaConcurrency Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.MediaConcurrency.MediaConcurrency
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.MediaConcurrency.MediaConcurrency
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.MediaConcurrency.MediaConcurrency
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.MediaConcurrency.MediaConcurrency
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.MediaConcurrency.MediaConcurrency
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.MediaConcurrency.MediaConcurrency
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.MediaConcurrency.MediaConcurrency
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.MediaConcurrency.MediaConcurrency


module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.OutboundCallerConfig

-- | The outbound caller ID name, number, and outbound whisper flow.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newOutboundCallerConfig</a> smart constructor.
data OutboundCallerConfig
OutboundCallerConfig' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> OutboundCallerConfig

-- | The caller ID number.
[$sel:outboundCallerIdNumberId:OutboundCallerConfig'] :: OutboundCallerConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The caller ID name.
[$sel:outboundCallerIdName:OutboundCallerConfig'] :: OutboundCallerConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The outbound whisper flow to be used during an outbound call.
[$sel:outboundFlowId:OutboundCallerConfig'] :: OutboundCallerConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>OutboundCallerConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:outboundCallerIdNumberId:OutboundCallerConfig'</a>,
--   <a>outboundCallerConfig_outboundCallerIdNumberId</a> - The caller ID
--   number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outboundCallerIdName:OutboundCallerConfig'</a>,
--   <a>outboundCallerConfig_outboundCallerIdName</a> - The caller ID name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outboundFlowId:OutboundCallerConfig'</a>,
--   <a>outboundCallerConfig_outboundFlowId</a> - The outbound whisper flow
--   to be used during an outbound call.
newOutboundCallerConfig :: OutboundCallerConfig

-- | The caller ID number.
outboundCallerConfig_outboundCallerIdNumberId :: Lens' OutboundCallerConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The caller ID name.
outboundCallerConfig_outboundCallerIdName :: Lens' OutboundCallerConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The outbound whisper flow to be used during an outbound call.
outboundCallerConfig_outboundFlowId :: Lens' OutboundCallerConfig (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.OutboundCallerConfig.OutboundCallerConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.OutboundCallerConfig.OutboundCallerConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.OutboundCallerConfig.OutboundCallerConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.OutboundCallerConfig.OutboundCallerConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.OutboundCallerConfig.OutboundCallerConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.OutboundCallerConfig.OutboundCallerConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.OutboundCallerConfig.OutboundCallerConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.OutboundCallerConfig.OutboundCallerConfig

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.PhoneNumberSummary

-- | Contains summary information about a phone number for a contact
--   center.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPhoneNumberSummary</a> smart constructor.
data PhoneNumberSummary
PhoneNumberSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe PhoneNumberType -> Maybe PhoneNumberCountryCode -> PhoneNumberSummary

-- | The phone number.
[$sel:phoneNumber:PhoneNumberSummary'] :: PhoneNumberSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the phone number.
[$sel:arn:PhoneNumberSummary'] :: PhoneNumberSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the phone number.
[$sel:id:PhoneNumberSummary'] :: PhoneNumberSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of phone number.
[$sel:phoneNumberType:PhoneNumberSummary'] :: PhoneNumberSummary -> Maybe PhoneNumberType

-- | The ISO country code.
[$sel:phoneNumberCountryCode:PhoneNumberSummary'] :: PhoneNumberSummary -> Maybe PhoneNumberCountryCode

-- | Create a value of <a>PhoneNumberSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumber:PhoneNumberSummary'</a>,
--   <a>phoneNumberSummary_phoneNumber</a> - The phone number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:PhoneNumberSummary'</a>, <a>phoneNumberSummary_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the phone number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:PhoneNumberSummary'</a>, <a>phoneNumberSummary_id</a> - The
--   identifier of the phone number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumberType:PhoneNumberSummary'</a>,
--   <a>phoneNumberSummary_phoneNumberType</a> - The type of phone number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneNumberCountryCode:PhoneNumberSummary'</a>,
--   <a>phoneNumberSummary_phoneNumberCountryCode</a> - The ISO country
--   code.
newPhoneNumberSummary :: PhoneNumberSummary

-- | The phone number.
phoneNumberSummary_phoneNumber :: Lens' PhoneNumberSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the phone number.
phoneNumberSummary_arn :: Lens' PhoneNumberSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the phone number.
phoneNumberSummary_id :: Lens' PhoneNumberSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of phone number.
phoneNumberSummary_phoneNumberType :: Lens' PhoneNumberSummary (Maybe PhoneNumberType)

-- | The ISO country code.
phoneNumberSummary_phoneNumberCountryCode :: Lens' PhoneNumberSummary (Maybe PhoneNumberCountryCode)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.PhoneNumberSummary.PhoneNumberSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.PhoneNumberSummary.PhoneNumberSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.PhoneNumberSummary.PhoneNumberSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.PhoneNumberSummary.PhoneNumberSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.PhoneNumberSummary.PhoneNumberSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.PhoneNumberSummary.PhoneNumberSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.PhoneNumberSummary.PhoneNumberSummary

--   
--   <a>$sel:contactFlowId:QueueQuickConnectConfig'</a>,
--   <a>queueQuickConnectConfig_contactFlowId</a> - The identifier of the
--   contact flow.
newQueueQuickConnectConfig :: Text -> Text -> QueueQuickConnectConfig

--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   about the queue for which metrics are returned.
--

--   channel used for grouping and filters.
newDimensions :: Dimensions

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Queue

-- | Contains information about a queue.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newQueue</a> smart constructor.
data Queue
Queue' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe QueueStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OutboundCallerConfig -> Maybe Text -> Queue

-- | The maximum number of contacts that can be in the queue before it is
--   considered full.
[$sel:maxContacts:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe Natural

-- | The status of the queue.
[$sel:status:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe QueueStatus

-- | The identifier for the queue.
[$sel:queueId:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the queue.
[$sel:name:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the queue.
[$sel:queueArn:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The description of the queue.
[$sel:description:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe Text

-- | The outbound caller ID name, number, and outbound whisper flow.
[$sel:outboundCallerConfig:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe OutboundCallerConfig

-- | The identifier for the hours of operation.
[$sel:hoursOfOperationId:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Queue</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxContacts:Queue'</a>, <a>queue_maxContacts</a> - The maximum
--   number of contacts that can be in the queue before it is considered
--   full.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Queue'</a>, <a>queue_status</a> - The status of the
--   queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueId:Queue'</a>, <a>queue_queueId</a> - The identifier for
--   the queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Queue'</a>, <a>queue_name</a> - The name of the queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueArn:Queue'</a>, <a>queue_queueArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) for the queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Queue'</a>, <a>queue_tags</a> - One or more tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Queue'</a>, <a>queue_description</a> - The
--   description of the queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outboundCallerConfig:Queue'</a>,
--   <a>queue_outboundCallerConfig</a> - The outbound caller ID name,
--   number, and outbound whisper flow.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hoursOfOperationId:Queue'</a>, <a>queue_hoursOfOperationId</a>
--   - The identifier for the hours of operation.
newQueue :: Queue

-- | The maximum number of contacts that can be in the queue before it is
--   considered full.
queue_maxContacts :: Lens' Queue (Maybe Natural)

-- | The status of the queue.
queue_status :: Lens' Queue (Maybe QueueStatus)

-- | The identifier for the queue.
queue_queueId :: Lens' Queue (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the queue.
queue_name :: Lens' Queue (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the queue.
queue_queueArn :: Lens' Queue (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more tags.
queue_tags :: Lens' Queue (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The description of the queue.
queue_description :: Lens' Queue (Maybe Text)

-- | The outbound caller ID name, number, and outbound whisper flow.
queue_outboundCallerConfig :: Lens' Queue (Maybe OutboundCallerConfig)

-- | The identifier for the hours of operation.
queue_hoursOfOperationId :: Lens' Queue (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Queue.Queue
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Queue.Queue
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Queue.Queue
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Queue.Queue
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Queue.Queue
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Queue.Queue
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Queue.Queue

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.QuickConnectSummary

-- | Contains summary information about a quick connect.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newQuickConnectSummary</a> smart constructor.
data QuickConnectSummary
QuickConnectSummary' :: Maybe QuickConnectType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> QuickConnectSummary

-- | The type of quick connect. In the Amazon Connect console, when you
--   create a quick connect, you are prompted to assign one of the
--   following types: Agent (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue
--   (QUEUE).
[$sel:quickConnectType:QuickConnectSummary'] :: QuickConnectSummary -> Maybe QuickConnectType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the quick connect.
[$sel:arn:QuickConnectSummary'] :: QuickConnectSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier for the quick connect.
[$sel:id:QuickConnectSummary'] :: QuickConnectSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the quick connect.
[$sel:name:QuickConnectSummary'] :: QuickConnectSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>QuickConnectSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:quickConnectType:QuickConnectSummary'</a>,
--   <a>quickConnectSummary_quickConnectType</a> - The type of quick
--   connect. In the Amazon Connect console, when you create a quick
--   connect, you are prompted to assign one of the following types: Agent
--   (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue (QUEUE).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:QuickConnectSummary'</a>, <a>quickConnectSummary_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the quick connect.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:QuickConnectSummary'</a>, <a>quickConnectSummary_id</a> -
--   The identifier for the quick connect.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:QuickConnectSummary'</a>, <a>quickConnectSummary_name</a>
--   - The name of the quick connect.
newQuickConnectSummary :: QuickConnectSummary

-- | The type of quick connect. In the Amazon Connect console, when you
--   create a quick connect, you are prompted to assign one of the
--   following types: Agent (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue
--   (QUEUE).
quickConnectSummary_quickConnectType :: Lens' QuickConnectSummary (Maybe QuickConnectType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the quick connect.
quickConnectSummary_arn :: Lens' QuickConnectSummary (Maybe Text)

quickConnectSummary_name :: Lens' QuickConnectSummary (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Reference

-- | A link that an agent selects to complete a given task. You can have up
--   to 4,096 UTF-8 bytes across all references for a contact.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReference</a> smart constructor.
data Reference
Reference' :: Text -> ReferenceType -> Reference

-- | A formatted URL that displays to an agent in the Contact Control Panel
--   (CCP)
[$sel:value:Reference'] :: Reference -> Text

-- | A valid URL.
[$sel:type':Reference'] :: Reference -> ReferenceType

-- | Create a value of <a>Reference</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Reference'</a>, <a>reference_value</a> - A formatted URL
--   that displays to an agent in the Contact Control Panel (CCP)
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Reference'</a>, <a>reference_type</a> - A valid URL.
newReference :: Text -> ReferenceType -> Reference

-- | A formatted URL that displays to an agent in the Contact Control Panel
--   (CCP)
reference_value :: Lens' Reference Text

-- | A valid URL.
reference_type :: Lens' Reference ReferenceType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Reference.Reference
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Reference.Reference
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Reference.Reference
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Reference.Reference
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Reference.Reference
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Reference.Reference
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Reference.Reference


module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.RoutingProfile

-- | Contains information about a routing profile.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRoutingProfile</a> smart constructor.
data RoutingProfile
RoutingProfile' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [MediaConcurrency] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> RoutingProfile

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:RoutingProfile'] :: RoutingProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the default outbound queue for this routing profile.
[$sel:defaultOutboundQueueId:RoutingProfile'] :: RoutingProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the routing profile.
[$sel:routingProfileId:RoutingProfile'] :: RoutingProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the routing profile.
[$sel:name:RoutingProfile'] :: RoutingProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The channels agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel (CCP) for
--   this routing profile.
[$sel:mediaConcurrencies:RoutingProfile'] :: RoutingProfile -> Maybe [MediaConcurrency]

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:RoutingProfile'] :: RoutingProfile -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The description of the routing profile.
[$sel:description:RoutingProfile'] :: RoutingProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the routing profile.
[$sel:routingProfileArn:RoutingProfile'] :: RoutingProfile -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RoutingProfile</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:RoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfile_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultOutboundQueueId:RoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfile_defaultOutboundQueueId</a> - The identifier of the
--   default outbound queue for this routing profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:routingProfileId:RoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfile_routingProfileId</a> - The identifier of the routing
--   profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:RoutingProfile'</a>, <a>routingProfile_name</a> - The
--   name of the routing profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:mediaConcurrencies:RoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfile_mediaConcurrencies</a> - The channels agents can
--   handle in the Contact Control Panel (CCP) for this routing profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:RoutingProfile'</a>, <a>routingProfile_tags</a> - One or
--   more tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:RoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfile_description</a> - The description of the routing
--   profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:routingProfileArn:RoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfile_routingProfileArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the routing profile.
newRoutingProfile :: RoutingProfile

--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
routingProfile_instanceId :: Lens' RoutingProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the default outbound queue for this routing profile.
routingProfile_defaultOutboundQueueId :: Lens' RoutingProfile (Maybe Text)

routingProfile_routingProfileId :: Lens' RoutingProfile (Maybe Text)

--   this routing profile.
routingProfile_mediaConcurrencies :: Lens' RoutingProfile (Maybe [MediaConcurrency])

-- | One or more tags.
routingProfile_tags :: Lens' RoutingProfile (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The description of the routing profile.
routingProfile_description :: Lens' RoutingProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the routing profile.
routingProfile_routingProfileArn :: Lens' RoutingProfile (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary

-- | Contains summary information about a routing profile queue.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary
RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Natural -> Natural -> Channel -> RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary

-- | The identifier for the queue.
[$sel:queueId:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'] :: RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the queue.
[$sel:queueArn:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'] :: RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary -> Text

-- | The name of the queue.
[$sel:queueName:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'] :: RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary -> Text

-- | The order in which contacts are to be handled for the queue. For more
--   information, see <a>Queues: priority and delay</a>.
[$sel:priority:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'] :: RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary -> Natural

-- | The delay, in seconds, that a contact should be in the queue before
--   they are routed to an available agent. For more information, see
--   <a>Queues: priority and delay</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect
--   Administrator Guide</i>.
[$sel:delay:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'] :: RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary -> Natural

-- | The channels this queue supports.
[$sel:channel:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'] :: RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary -> Channel

-- | Create a value of <a>RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueId:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_queueId</a> - The identifier for
--   the queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueArn:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_queueArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueName:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_queueName</a> - The name of the
--   queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_priority</a> - The order in which
--   contacts are to be handled for the queue. For more information, see
--   <a>Queues: priority and delay</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:delay:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_delay</a> - The delay, in seconds,
--   that a contact should be in the queue before they are routed to an
--   available agent. For more information, see <a>Queues: priority and
--   delay</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channel:RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_channel</a> - The channels this
--   queue supports.

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the queue.

routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_queueName :: Lens' RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary Text

--   information, see <a>Queues: priority and delay</a>.
routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_priority :: Lens' RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary Natural

--   <a>Queues: priority and delay</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect
--   Administrator Guide</i>.
routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_delay :: Lens' RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary Natural

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.RoutingProfileQueueConfig

-- | Contains information about the queue and channel for which priority
--   and delay can be set.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRoutingProfileQueueConfig</a> smart constructor.
data RoutingProfileQueueConfig
RoutingProfileQueueConfig' :: RoutingProfileQueueReference -> Natural -> Natural -> RoutingProfileQueueConfig

-- | Contains information about a queue resource.
[$sel:queueReference:RoutingProfileQueueConfig'] :: RoutingProfileQueueConfig -> RoutingProfileQueueReference

-- | The order in which contacts are to be handled for the queue. For more
--   information, see <a>Queues: priority and delay</a>.
[$sel:priority:RoutingProfileQueueConfig'] :: RoutingProfileQueueConfig -> Natural

-- | The delay, in seconds, a contact should be in the queue before they
--   are routed to an available agent. For more information, see <a>Queues:
--   priority and delay</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:delay:RoutingProfileQueueConfig'] :: RoutingProfileQueueConfig -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>RoutingProfileQueueConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueReference:RoutingProfileQueueConfig'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfileQueueConfig_queueReference</a> - Contains information
--   about a queue resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:priority:RoutingProfileQueueConfig'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfileQueueConfig_priority</a> - The order in which
--   contacts are to be handled for the queue. For more information, see
--   <a>Queues: priority and delay</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:delay:RoutingProfileQueueConfig'</a>,
--   <a>routingProfileQueueConfig_delay</a> - The delay, in seconds, a
--   contact should be in the queue before they are routed to an available
--   agent. For more information, see <a>Queues: priority and delay</a> in
--   the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
newRoutingProfileQueueConfig :: RoutingProfileQueueReference -> Natural -> Natural -> RoutingProfileQueueConfig

-- | Contains information about a queue resource.
routingProfileQueueConfig_queueReference :: Lens' RoutingProfileQueueConfig RoutingProfileQueueReference

-- | The order in which contacts are to be handled for the queue. For more
--   information, see <a>Queues: priority and delay</a>.
routingProfileQueueConfig_priority :: Lens' RoutingProfileQueueConfig Natural

-- | The delay, in seconds, a contact should be in the queue before they
--   are routed to an available agent. For more information, see <a>Queues:
--   priority and delay</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator
--   Guide</i>.
routingProfileQueueConfig_delay :: Lens' RoutingProfileQueueConfig Natural
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.RoutingProfileQueueConfig.RoutingProfileQueueConfig

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.InstanceStorageConfig

-- | The storage configuration for the instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceStorageConfig</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceStorageConfig
InstanceStorageConfig' :: Maybe KinesisStreamConfig -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseConfig -> Maybe KinesisVideoStreamConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe S3Config -> StorageType -> InstanceStorageConfig

-- | The configuration of the Kinesis data stream.
[$sel:kinesisStreamConfig:InstanceStorageConfig'] :: InstanceStorageConfig -> Maybe KinesisStreamConfig

-- | The configuration of the Kinesis Firehose delivery stream.
[$sel:kinesisFirehoseConfig:InstanceStorageConfig'] :: InstanceStorageConfig -> Maybe KinesisFirehoseConfig

-- | The configuration of the Kinesis video stream.
[$sel:kinesisVideoStreamConfig:InstanceStorageConfig'] :: InstanceStorageConfig -> Maybe KinesisVideoStreamConfig

-- | The existing association identifier that uniquely identifies the
--   resource type and storage config for the given instance ID.
[$sel:associationId:InstanceStorageConfig'] :: InstanceStorageConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The S3 bucket configuration.
[$sel:s3Config:InstanceStorageConfig'] :: InstanceStorageConfig -> Maybe S3Config

-- | A valid storage type.
[$sel:storageType:InstanceStorageConfig'] :: InstanceStorageConfig -> StorageType

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceStorageConfig</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisStreamConfig:InstanceStorageConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceStorageConfig_kinesisStreamConfig</a> - The configuration
--   of the Kinesis data stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisFirehoseConfig:InstanceStorageConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceStorageConfig_kinesisFirehoseConfig</a> - The configuration
--   of the Kinesis Firehose delivery stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:kinesisVideoStreamConfig:InstanceStorageConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceStorageConfig_kinesisVideoStreamConfig</a> - The
--   configuration of the Kinesis video stream.
--   
--   <a>$sel:associationId:InstanceStorageConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceStorageConfig_associationId</a> - The existing association
--   identifier that uniquely identifies the resource type and storage
--   config for the given instance ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:s3Config:InstanceStorageConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceStorageConfig_s3Config</a> - The S3 bucket configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:storageType:InstanceStorageConfig'</a>,
--   <a>instanceStorageConfig_storageType</a> - A valid storage type.
newInstanceStorageConfig :: StorageType -> InstanceStorageConfig

-- | The configuration of the Kinesis data stream.
instanceStorageConfig_kinesisStreamConfig :: Lens' InstanceStorageConfig (Maybe KinesisStreamConfig)

-- | The configuration of the Kinesis Firehose delivery stream.
instanceStorageConfig_kinesisFirehoseConfig :: Lens' InstanceStorageConfig (Maybe KinesisFirehoseConfig)

-- | The configuration of the Kinesis video stream.
instanceStorageConfig_kinesisVideoStreamConfig :: Lens' InstanceStorageConfig (Maybe KinesisVideoStreamConfig)

-- | The existing association identifier that uniquely identifies the
--   resource type and storage config for the given instance ID.
instanceStorageConfig_associationId :: Lens' InstanceStorageConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The S3 bucket configuration.
instanceStorageConfig_s3Config :: Lens' InstanceStorageConfig (Maybe S3Config)

-- | A valid storage type.
instanceStorageConfig_storageType :: Lens' InstanceStorageConfig StorageType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.InstanceStorageConfig.InstanceStorageConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.InstanceStorageConfig.InstanceStorageConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.InstanceStorageConfig.InstanceStorageConfig

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Threshold

-- | Contains information about the threshold for service level metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThreshold</a> smart constructor.
data Threshold
Threshold' :: Maybe Double -> Maybe Comparison -> Threshold

-- | The threshold value to compare.
[$sel:thresholdValue:Threshold'] :: Threshold -> Maybe Double

-- | The type of comparison. Only "less than" (LT) comparisons are
--   supported.
[$sel:comparison:Threshold'] :: Threshold -> Maybe Comparison

-- | Create a value of <a>Threshold</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thresholdValue:Threshold'</a>, <a>threshold_thresholdValue</a>
--   - The threshold value to compare.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparison:Threshold'</a>, <a>threshold_comparison</a> - The
--   type of comparison. Only "less than" (LT) comparisons are supported.
newThreshold :: Threshold

-- | The threshold value to compare.
threshold_thresholdValue :: Lens' Threshold (Maybe Double)

-- | The type of comparison. Only "less than" (LT) comparisons are
--   supported.
threshold_comparison :: Lens' Threshold (Maybe Comparison)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Threshold.Threshold
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Threshold.Threshold
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Threshold.Threshold
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Threshold.Threshold
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Threshold.Threshold
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Threshold.Threshold
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Threshold.Threshold
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.Threshold.Threshold

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HistoricalMetric

-- | Contains information about a historical metric. For a description of
--   each metric, see <a>Historical Metrics Definitions</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHistoricalMetric</a> smart constructor.
data HistoricalMetric
HistoricalMetric' :: Maybe Threshold -> Maybe Unit -> Maybe HistoricalMetricName -> Maybe Statistic -> HistoricalMetric

-- | The threshold for the metric, used with service level metrics.
[$sel:threshold:HistoricalMetric'] :: HistoricalMetric -> Maybe Threshold

-- | The unit for the metric.
[$sel:unit:HistoricalMetric'] :: HistoricalMetric -> Maybe Unit

-- | The name of the metric.
[$sel:name:HistoricalMetric'] :: HistoricalMetric -> Maybe HistoricalMetricName

-- | The statistic for the metric.
[$sel:statistic:HistoricalMetric'] :: HistoricalMetric -> Maybe Statistic

-- | Create a value of <a>HistoricalMetric</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:HistoricalMetric'</a>,
--   <a>historicalMetric_threshold</a> - The threshold for the metric, used
--   with service level metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:HistoricalMetric'</a>, <a>historicalMetric_unit</a> - The
--   unit for the metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:HistoricalMetric'</a>, <a>historicalMetric_name</a> - The
--   name of the metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:HistoricalMetric'</a>,
--   <a>historicalMetric_statistic</a> - The statistic for the metric.
newHistoricalMetric :: HistoricalMetric

-- | The threshold for the metric, used with service level metrics.
historicalMetric_threshold :: Lens' HistoricalMetric (Maybe Threshold)

-- | The unit for the metric.
historicalMetric_unit :: Lens' HistoricalMetric (Maybe Unit)

-- | The name of the metric.
historicalMetric_name :: Lens' HistoricalMetric (Maybe HistoricalMetricName)

-- | The statistic for the metric.
historicalMetric_statistic :: Lens' HistoricalMetric (Maybe Statistic)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HistoricalMetric.HistoricalMetric
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HistoricalMetric.HistoricalMetric
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HistoricalMetric.HistoricalMetric
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HistoricalMetric.HistoricalMetric
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HistoricalMetric.HistoricalMetric
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HistoricalMetric.HistoricalMetric
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HistoricalMetric.HistoricalMetric
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.HistoricalMetric.HistoricalMetric

--   metrics.

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UseCase

-- | Contains the use case.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUseCase</a> smart constructor.
data UseCase
UseCase' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe UseCaseType -> Maybe Text -> UseCase

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the use case.
[$sel:useCaseArn:UseCase'] :: UseCase -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of use case to associate to the integration association. Each
--   integration association can have only one of each use case type.
[$sel:useCaseType:UseCase'] :: UseCase -> Maybe UseCaseType

-- | The identifier for the use case.
[$sel:useCaseId:UseCase'] :: UseCase -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UseCase</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCaseArn:UseCase'</a>, <a>useCase_useCaseArn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the use case.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCaseType:UseCase'</a>, <a>useCase_useCaseType</a> - The
--   type of use case to associate to the integration association. Each
--   integration association can have only one of each use case type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCaseId:UseCase'</a>, <a>useCase_useCaseId</a> - The
--   identifier for the use case.
newUseCase :: UseCase

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the use case.
useCase_useCaseArn :: Lens' UseCase (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of use case to associate to the integration association. Each
--   integration association can have only one of each use case type.
useCase_useCaseType :: Lens' UseCase (Maybe UseCaseType)

-- | The identifier for the use case.
useCase_useCaseId :: Lens' UseCase (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UseCase.UseCase
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UseCase.UseCase
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UseCase.UseCase
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UseCase.UseCase
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UseCase.UseCase
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UseCase.UseCase
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UseCase.UseCase


module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserIdentityInfo

-- | Contains information about the identity of a user.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserIdentityInfo</a> smart constructor.
data UserIdentityInfo
UserIdentityInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> UserIdentityInfo

-- | The email address. If you are using SAML for identity management and
--   include this parameter, an error is returned.
[$sel:email:UserIdentityInfo'] :: UserIdentityInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The last name. This is required if you are using Amazon Connect or
--   SAML for identity management.
[$sel:lastName:UserIdentityInfo'] :: UserIdentityInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The first name. This is required if you are using Amazon Connect or
--   SAML for identity management.
[$sel:firstName:UserIdentityInfo'] :: UserIdentityInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UserIdentityInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:UserIdentityInfo'</a>, <a>userIdentityInfo_email</a> -
--   The email address. If you are using SAML for identity management and
--   include this parameter, an error is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastName:UserIdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>userIdentityInfo_lastName</a> - The last name. This is required if
--   you are using Amazon Connect or SAML for identity management.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firstName:UserIdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>userIdentityInfo_firstName</a> - The first name. This is required
--   if you are using Amazon Connect or SAML for identity management.
newUserIdentityInfo :: UserIdentityInfo

-- | The email address. If you are using SAML for identity management and
--   include this parameter, an error is returned.
userIdentityInfo_email :: Lens' UserIdentityInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The last name. This is required if you are using Amazon Connect or
--   SAML for identity management.
userIdentityInfo_lastName :: Lens' UserIdentityInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The first name. This is required if you are using Amazon Connect or
--   SAML for identity management.
userIdentityInfo_firstName :: Lens' UserIdentityInfo (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserIdentityInfo.UserIdentityInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserIdentityInfo.UserIdentityInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserIdentityInfo.UserIdentityInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserIdentityInfo.UserIdentityInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserIdentityInfo.UserIdentityInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserIdentityInfo.UserIdentityInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserIdentityInfo.UserIdentityInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserIdentityInfo.UserIdentityInfo


module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserPhoneConfig

-- | Contains information about the phone configuration settings for a
--   user.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserPhoneConfig</a> smart constructor.
data UserPhoneConfig
UserPhoneConfig' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> PhoneType -> UserPhoneConfig

-- | The Auto accept setting.
[$sel:autoAccept:UserPhoneConfig'] :: UserPhoneConfig -> Maybe Bool

-- | The After Call Work (ACW) timeout setting, in seconds.
[$sel:afterContactWorkTimeLimit:UserPhoneConfig'] :: UserPhoneConfig -> Maybe Natural

-- | The phone number for the user's desk phone.
[$sel:deskPhoneNumber:UserPhoneConfig'] :: UserPhoneConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The phone type.
[$sel:phoneType:UserPhoneConfig'] :: UserPhoneConfig -> PhoneType

-- | Create a value of <a>UserPhoneConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:autoAccept:UserPhoneConfig'</a>,
--   <a>userPhoneConfig_autoAccept</a> - The Auto accept setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:afterContactWorkTimeLimit:UserPhoneConfig'</a>,
--   <a>userPhoneConfig_afterContactWorkTimeLimit</a> - The After Call Work
--   (ACW) timeout setting, in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deskPhoneNumber:UserPhoneConfig'</a>,
--   <a>userPhoneConfig_deskPhoneNumber</a> - The phone number for the
--   user's desk phone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneType:UserPhoneConfig'</a>,
--   <a>userPhoneConfig_phoneType</a> - The phone type.
newUserPhoneConfig :: PhoneType -> UserPhoneConfig

-- | The Auto accept setting.
userPhoneConfig_autoAccept :: Lens' UserPhoneConfig (Maybe Bool)

-- | The After Call Work (ACW) timeout setting, in seconds.
userPhoneConfig_afterContactWorkTimeLimit :: Lens' UserPhoneConfig (Maybe Natural)

-- | The phone number for the user's desk phone.
userPhoneConfig_deskPhoneNumber :: Lens' UserPhoneConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The phone type.
userPhoneConfig_phoneType :: Lens' UserPhoneConfig PhoneType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserPhoneConfig.UserPhoneConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserPhoneConfig.UserPhoneConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.Types.UserPhoneConfig.UserPhoneConfig

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.User

-- | Contains information about a user account for a Amazon Connect
--   instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUser</a> smart constructor.
data User
User' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe UserIdentityInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe UserPhoneConfig -> Maybe Text -> User

-- | The identifiers of the security profiles for the user.
[$sel:securityProfileIds:User'] :: User -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Information about the user identity.
[$sel:identityInfo:User'] :: User -> Maybe UserIdentityInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the user account.
[$sel:arn:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the user account.
[$sel:id:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the hierarchy group for the user.
[$sel:hierarchyGroupId:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the user account in the directory used for identity
--   management.
[$sel:directoryUserId:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the routing profile for the user.
[$sel:routingProfileId:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | The tags.
[$sel:tags:User'] :: User -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Information about the phone configuration for the user.
[$sel:phoneConfig:User'] :: User -> Maybe UserPhoneConfig

-- | The user name assigned to the user account.
[$sel:username:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>User</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileIds:User'</a>, <a>user_securityProfileIds</a> -
--   The identifiers of the security profiles for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityInfo:User'</a>, <a>user_identityInfo</a> - Information
--   about the user identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:User'</a>, <a>user_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the user account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:User'</a>, <a>user_id</a> - The identifier of the user
--   account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hierarchyGroupId:User'</a>, <a>user_hierarchyGroupId</a> - The
--   identifier of the hierarchy group for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:directoryUserId:User'</a>, <a>user_directoryUserId</a> - The
--   identifier of the user account in the directory used for identity
--   management.
--   
--   <a>$sel:routingProfileId:User'</a>, <a>user_routingProfileId</a> - The
--   identifier of the routing profile for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:User'</a>, <a>user_tags</a> - The tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneConfig:User'</a>, <a>user_phoneConfig</a> - Information
--   about the phone configuration for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:User'</a>, <a>user_username</a> - The user name
--   assigned to the user account.
newUser :: User

-- | The identifiers of the security profiles for the user.
user_securityProfileIds :: Lens' User (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | Information about the user identity.
user_identityInfo :: Lens' User (Maybe UserIdentityInfo)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the user account.
user_arn :: Lens' User (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the user account.
user_id :: Lens' User (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the hierarchy group for the user.
user_hierarchyGroupId :: Lens' User (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the user account in the directory used for identity
--   management.
user_directoryUserId :: Lens' User (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the routing profile for the user.
user_routingProfileId :: Lens' User (Maybe Text)

-- | The tags.

-- | Information about the phone configuration for the user.
user_phoneConfig :: Lens' User (Maybe UserPhoneConfig)

-- | The user name assigned to the user account.
user_username :: Lens' User (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.QuickConnectConfig

-- | Contains configuration settings for a quick connect.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newQuickConnectConfig</a> smart constructor.
data QuickConnectConfig
QuickConnectConfig' :: Maybe UserQuickConnectConfig -> Maybe PhoneNumberQuickConnectConfig -> Maybe QueueQuickConnectConfig -> QuickConnectType -> QuickConnectConfig

-- | The user configuration. This is required only if QuickConnectType is
--   USER.
[$sel:userConfig:QuickConnectConfig'] :: QuickConnectConfig -> Maybe UserQuickConnectConfig

-- | The phone configuration. This is required only if QuickConnectType is
--   PHONE_NUMBER.
[$sel:phoneConfig:QuickConnectConfig'] :: QuickConnectConfig -> Maybe PhoneNumberQuickConnectConfig

-- | The queue configuration. This is required only if QuickConnectType is
--   QUEUE.
[$sel:queueConfig:QuickConnectConfig'] :: QuickConnectConfig -> Maybe QueueQuickConnectConfig

-- | The type of quick connect. In the Amazon Connect console, when you
--   create a quick connect, you are prompted to assign one of the
--   following types: Agent (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue
--   (QUEUE).
[$sel:quickConnectType:QuickConnectConfig'] :: QuickConnectConfig -> QuickConnectType

-- | Create a value of <a>QuickConnectConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userConfig:QuickConnectConfig'</a>,
--   <a>quickConnectConfig_userConfig</a> - The user configuration. This is
--   required only if QuickConnectType is USER.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneConfig:QuickConnectConfig'</a>,
--   <a>quickConnectConfig_phoneConfig</a> - The phone configuration. This
--   is required only if QuickConnectType is PHONE_NUMBER.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueConfig:QuickConnectConfig'</a>,
--   <a>quickConnectConfig_queueConfig</a> - The queue configuration. This
--   is required only if QuickConnectType is QUEUE.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quickConnectType:QuickConnectConfig'</a>,
--   <a>quickConnectConfig_quickConnectType</a> - The type of quick
--   connect. In the Amazon Connect console, when you create a quick
--   connect, you are prompted to assign one of the following types: Agent
--   (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue (QUEUE).
newQuickConnectConfig :: QuickConnectType -> QuickConnectConfig

-- | The user configuration. This is required only if QuickConnectType is
--   USER.
quickConnectConfig_userConfig :: Lens' QuickConnectConfig (Maybe UserQuickConnectConfig)

-- | The phone configuration. This is required only if QuickConnectType is
--   PHONE_NUMBER.
quickConnectConfig_phoneConfig :: Lens' QuickConnectConfig (Maybe PhoneNumberQuickConnectConfig)

-- | The queue configuration. This is required only if QuickConnectType is
--   QUEUE.
quickConnectConfig_queueConfig :: Lens' QuickConnectConfig (Maybe QueueQuickConnectConfig)

-- | The type of quick connect. In the Amazon Connect console, when you
--   create a quick connect, you are prompted to assign one of the
--   following types: Agent (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue
--   (QUEUE).
quickConnectConfig_quickConnectType :: Lens' QuickConnectConfig QuickConnectType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.Types.QuickConnectConfig.QuickConnectConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.Types.QuickConnectConfig.QuickConnectConfig

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.Types.QuickConnectConfig.QuickConnectConfig

module Network.AWS.Connect.Types.QuickConnect

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newQuickConnect</a> smart constructor.
data QuickConnect

-- | The identifier for the quick connect.
[$sel:quickConnectId:QuickConnect'] :: QuickConnect -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the quick connect.

--   connect.

--   the quick connect.
--

--   the quick connect.

--   tags.

--   of the quick connect.
