module Network.AWS.Connect.Types

-- | API version <tt>2017-08-08</tt> of the Amazon Connect Service SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The service quota has been exceeded.
_ServiceQuotaExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The contact is not permitted.
_OutboundContactNotPermittedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource already has that name.
_ResourceConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The contact flow has not been published.
_ContactFlowNotPublishedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | No user with the specified credentials was found in the Amazon Connect
--   instance.
_UserNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Request processing failed because of an error or failure with the
--   service.
_InternalServiceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource with the specified name already exists.
_DuplicateResourceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The throttling limit has been exceeded.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | One or more of the specified parameters are not valid.
_InvalidParameterException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request is not valid.
_InvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The contact flow is not valid.
_InvalidContactFlowException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The contact with the specified ID is not active or does not exist.
_ContactNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The allowed limit for the resource has been exceeded.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | That resource is already in use. Please try another.
_ResourceInUseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource was not found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Outbound calls to the destination number are not allowed.
_DestinationNotAllowedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
newtype AgentStatusState
AgentStatusState' :: Text -> AgentStatusState
[fromAgentStatusState] :: AgentStatusState -> Text
pattern AgentStatusState_DISABLED :: AgentStatusState
pattern AgentStatusState_ENABLED :: AgentStatusState
newtype AgentStatusType
AgentStatusType' :: Text -> AgentStatusType
[fromAgentStatusType] :: AgentStatusType -> Text
pattern AgentStatusType_CUSTOM :: AgentStatusType
pattern AgentStatusType_OFFLINE :: AgentStatusType
pattern AgentStatusType_ROUTABLE :: AgentStatusType
newtype Channel
Channel' :: Text -> Channel
[fromChannel] :: Channel -> Text
pattern Channel_CHAT :: Channel
pattern Channel_TASK :: Channel
pattern Channel_VOICE :: Channel
newtype Comparison
Comparison' :: Text -> Comparison
[fromComparison] :: Comparison -> Text
pattern Comparison_LT :: Comparison
newtype ContactFlowType
ContactFlowType' :: Text -> ContactFlowType
[fromContactFlowType] :: ContactFlowType -> Text
pattern ContactFlowType_AGENT_HOLD :: ContactFlowType
pattern ContactFlowType_AGENT_TRANSFER :: ContactFlowType
pattern ContactFlowType_AGENT_WHISPER :: ContactFlowType
pattern ContactFlowType_CONTACT_FLOW :: ContactFlowType
pattern ContactFlowType_CUSTOMER_HOLD :: ContactFlowType
pattern ContactFlowType_CUSTOMER_QUEUE :: ContactFlowType
pattern ContactFlowType_CUSTOMER_WHISPER :: ContactFlowType
pattern ContactFlowType_OUTBOUND_WHISPER :: ContactFlowType
pattern ContactFlowType_QUEUE_TRANSFER :: ContactFlowType

-- | The current metric names.
newtype CurrentMetricName
CurrentMetricName' :: Text -> CurrentMetricName
[fromCurrentMetricName] :: CurrentMetricName -> Text
pattern CurrentMetricName_AGENTS_AFTER_CONTACT_WORK :: CurrentMetricName
pattern CurrentMetricName_AGENTS_AVAILABLE :: CurrentMetricName
pattern CurrentMetricName_AGENTS_ERROR :: CurrentMetricName
pattern CurrentMetricName_AGENTS_NON_PRODUCTIVE :: CurrentMetricName
pattern CurrentMetricName_AGENTS_ONLINE :: CurrentMetricName
pattern CurrentMetricName_AGENTS_ON_CALL :: CurrentMetricName
pattern CurrentMetricName_AGENTS_ON_CONTACT :: CurrentMetricName
pattern CurrentMetricName_AGENTS_STAFFED :: CurrentMetricName
pattern CurrentMetricName_CONTACTS_IN_QUEUE :: CurrentMetricName
pattern CurrentMetricName_CONTACTS_SCHEDULED :: CurrentMetricName
pattern CurrentMetricName_OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE :: CurrentMetricName
pattern CurrentMetricName_SLOTS_ACTIVE :: CurrentMetricName

-- | Contains information about an agent status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAgentStatus</a> smart constructor.
data AgentStatus
AgentStatus' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AgentStatusState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AgentStatusType -> AgentStatus

-- | The display order of the agent status.
[$sel:displayOrder:AgentStatus'] :: AgentStatus -> Maybe Natural

-- | The identifier of the agent status.
[$sel:agentStatusId:AgentStatus'] :: AgentStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the agent status.
[$sel:name:AgentStatus'] :: AgentStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The state of the agent status.
[$sel:state:AgentStatus'] :: AgentStatus -> Maybe AgentStatusState

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:AgentStatus'] :: AgentStatus -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The description of the agent status.
[$sel:description:AgentStatus'] :: AgentStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the agent status.
[$sel:agentStatusARN:AgentStatus'] :: AgentStatus -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of agent status.
[$sel:type':AgentStatus'] :: AgentStatus -> Maybe AgentStatusType

-- | Create a value of <a>AgentStatus</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayOrder:AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_displayOrder</a>
--   - The display order of the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentStatusId:AgentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>agentStatus_agentStatusId</a> - The identifier of the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_name</a> - The name of
--   the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_state</a> - The state
--   of the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_tags</a> - One or more
--   tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_description</a> -
--   The description of the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentStatusARN:AgentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>agentStatus_agentStatusARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_type</a> - The type of
--   agent status.
newAgentStatus :: AgentStatus

-- | The display order of the agent status.
agentStatus_displayOrder :: Lens' AgentStatus (Maybe Natural)

-- | The identifier of the agent status.
agentStatus_agentStatusId :: Lens' AgentStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the agent status.
agentStatus_name :: Lens' AgentStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The state of the agent status.
agentStatus_state :: Lens' AgentStatus (Maybe AgentStatusState)

-- | One or more tags.
agentStatus_tags :: Lens' AgentStatus (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The description of the agent status.
agentStatus_description :: Lens' AgentStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the agent status.
agentStatus_agentStatusARN :: Lens' AgentStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of agent status.
agentStatus_type :: Lens' AgentStatus (Maybe AgentStatusType)

-- | Summary information for an agent status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAgentStatusSummary</a> smart constructor.
data AgentStatusSummary
AgentStatusSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AgentStatusType -> AgentStatusSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the agent status.
[$sel:arn:AgentStatusSummary'] :: AgentStatusSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier for an agent status.
[$sel:id:AgentStatusSummary'] :: AgentStatusSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the agent status.
[$sel:name:AgentStatusSummary'] :: AgentStatusSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the agent status.
[$sel:type':AgentStatusSummary'] :: AgentStatusSummary -> Maybe AgentStatusType

-- | Create a value of <a>AgentStatusSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:AgentStatusSummary'</a>, <a>agentStatusSummary_arn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:AgentStatusSummary'</a>, <a>agentStatusSummary_id</a> - The
--   identifier for an agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AgentStatusSummary'</a>, <a>agentStatusSummary_name</a> -
--   The name of the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AgentStatusSummary'</a>, <a>agentStatusSummary_type</a>
--   - The type of the agent status.
newAgentStatusSummary :: AgentStatusSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the agent status.
agentStatusSummary_arn :: Lens' AgentStatusSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier for an agent status.
agentStatusSummary_id :: Lens' AgentStatusSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the agent status.
agentStatusSummary_name :: Lens' AgentStatusSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the agent status.
agentStatusSummary_type :: Lens' AgentStatusSummary (Maybe AgentStatusType)

-- | Configuration of the answering machine detection.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAnswerMachineDetectionConfig</a> smart constructor.
data AnswerMachineDetectionConfig
AnswerMachineDetectionConfig' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> AnswerMachineDetectionConfig

-- | The flag to indicate if answer machine detection analysis needs to be
--   performed for a voice call. If set to <tt>true</tt>,
--   <tt>TrafficType</tt> must be set as <tt>CAMPAIGN</tt>.
[$sel:enableAnswerMachineDetection:AnswerMachineDetectionConfig'] :: AnswerMachineDetectionConfig -> Maybe Bool

-- | Wait for the answering machine prompt.
[$sel:awaitAnswerMachinePrompt:AnswerMachineDetectionConfig'] :: AnswerMachineDetectionConfig -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>AnswerMachineDetectionConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableAnswerMachineDetection:AnswerMachineDetectionConfig'</a>,
--   <a>answerMachineDetectionConfig_enableAnswerMachineDetection</a> - The
--   flag to indicate if answer machine detection analysis needs to be
--   performed for a voice call. If set to <tt>true</tt>,
--   <tt>TrafficType</tt> must be set as <tt>CAMPAIGN</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:awaitAnswerMachinePrompt:AnswerMachineDetectionConfig'</a>,
--   <a>answerMachineDetectionConfig_awaitAnswerMachinePrompt</a> - Wait
--   for the answering machine prompt.
newAnswerMachineDetectionConfig :: AnswerMachineDetectionConfig

-- | The flag to indicate if answer machine detection analysis needs to be
--   performed for a voice call. If set to <tt>true</tt>,
--   <tt>TrafficType</tt> must be set as <tt>CAMPAIGN</tt>.
answerMachineDetectionConfig_enableAnswerMachineDetection :: Lens' AnswerMachineDetectionConfig (Maybe Bool)

-- | Wait for the answering machine prompt.
answerMachineDetectionConfig_awaitAnswerMachinePrompt :: Lens' AnswerMachineDetectionConfig (Maybe Bool)

-- | A toggle for an individual feature at the instance level.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttribute</a> smart constructor.
data Attribute
Attribute' :: Maybe InstanceAttributeType -> Maybe Text -> Attribute

-- | The type of attribute.
[$sel:attributeType:Attribute'] :: Attribute -> Maybe InstanceAttributeType

-- | The value of the attribute.
[$sel:value:Attribute'] :: Attribute -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Attribute</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributeType:Attribute'</a>, <a>attribute_attributeType</a> -
--   The type of attribute.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Attribute'</a>, <a>attribute_value</a> - The value of
--   the attribute.
newAttribute :: Attribute

-- | The type of attribute.
attribute_attributeType :: Lens' Attribute (Maybe InstanceAttributeType)

-- | The value of the attribute.
attribute_value :: Lens' Attribute (Maybe Text)

-- | A chat message.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newChatMessage</a> smart constructor.
data ChatMessage
ChatMessage' :: Text -> Text -> ChatMessage

-- | The type of the content. Supported types are text and plain.
[$sel:contentType:ChatMessage'] :: ChatMessage -> Text

-- | The content of the chat message.
[$sel:content:ChatMessage'] :: ChatMessage -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ChatMessage</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentType:ChatMessage'</a>, <a>chatMessage_contentType</a> -
--   The type of the content. Supported types are text and plain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:ChatMessage'</a>, <a>chatMessage_content</a> - The
--   content of the chat message.
newChatMessage :: Text -> Text -> ChatMessage

-- | The type of the content. Supported types are text and plain.
chatMessage_contentType :: Lens' ChatMessage Text

-- | The content of the chat message.
chatMessage_content :: Lens' ChatMessage Text

-- | Contains information about a contact flow.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactFlow</a> smart constructor.
data ContactFlow

[$sel:arn:ContactFlow'] :: ContactFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the contact flow.
[$sel:id:ContactFlow'] :: ContactFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the contact flow.
[$sel:name:ContactFlow'] :: ContactFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | The content of the contact flow.
[$sel:content:ContactFlow'] :: ContactFlow -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:ContactFlow'] :: ContactFlow -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The description of the contact flow.
[$sel:description:ContactFlow'] :: ContactFlow -> Maybe Text

--   see <a>Choose a Contact Flow Type</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect
--   Administrator Guide</i>.
[$sel:type':ContactFlow'] :: ContactFlow -> Maybe ContactFlowType

-- | Contains credentials to use for federation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCredentials</a> smart constructor.
data Credentials
Credentials' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Credentials

-- | Renews the expiration timer for a generated token.
[$sel:refreshTokenExpiration:Credentials'] :: Credentials -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An access token generated for a federated user to access Amazon
--   Connect.
[$sel:accessToken:Credentials'] :: Credentials -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | A token generated with an expiration time for the session a user is
--   logged in to Amazon Connect.
[$sel:accessTokenExpiration:Credentials'] :: Credentials -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Renews a token generated for a user to access the Amazon Connect
--   instance.
[$sel:refreshToken:Credentials'] :: Credentials -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>Credentials</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshTokenExpiration:Credentials'</a>,
--   <a>credentials_refreshTokenExpiration</a> - Renews the expiration
--   timer for a generated token.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessToken:Credentials'</a>, <a>credentials_accessToken</a> -
--   An access token generated for a federated user to access Amazon
--   Connect.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessTokenExpiration:Credentials'</a>,
--   <a>credentials_accessTokenExpiration</a> - A token generated with an
--   expiration time for the session a user is logged in to Amazon Connect.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshToken:Credentials'</a>, <a>credentials_refreshToken</a>
--   - Renews a token generated for a user to access the Amazon Connect
--   instance.
newCredentials :: Credentials

-- | Renews the expiration timer for a generated token.
credentials_refreshTokenExpiration :: Lens' Credentials (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An access token generated for a federated user to access Amazon
--   Connect.
credentials_accessToken :: Lens' Credentials (Maybe Text)

-- | A token generated with an expiration time for the session a user is
--   logged in to Amazon Connect.
credentials_accessTokenExpiration :: Lens' Credentials (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Renews a token generated for a user to access the Amazon Connect
--   instance.
credentials_refreshToken :: Lens' Credentials (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about a real-time metric. For a description of
--   each metric, see <a>Real-time Metrics Definitions</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCurrentMetric</a> smart constructor.
data CurrentMetric
CurrentMetric' :: Maybe Unit -> Maybe CurrentMetricName -> CurrentMetric

-- | The unit for the metric.
[$sel:unit:CurrentMetric'] :: CurrentMetric -> Maybe Unit

-- | The name of the metric.
[$sel:name:CurrentMetric'] :: CurrentMetric -> Maybe CurrentMetricName

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:CurrentMetric'</a>, <a>currentMetric_unit</a> - The unit
--   for the metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CurrentMetric'</a>, <a>currentMetric_name</a> - The name
--   of the metric.
newCurrentMetric :: CurrentMetric

-- | The unit for the metric.
currentMetric_unit :: Lens' CurrentMetric (Maybe Unit)

-- | The name of the metric.
currentMetric_name :: Lens' CurrentMetric (Maybe CurrentMetricName)

-- | Contains the data for a real-time metric.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCurrentMetricData</a> smart constructor.
data CurrentMetricData

--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   - Information about the metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:CurrentMetricData'</a>, <a>currentMetricData_value</a> -
--   The value of the metric.
newCurrentMetricData :: CurrentMetricData

-- | Information about the metric.
currentMetricData_metric :: Lens' CurrentMetricData (Maybe CurrentMetric)

-- | The value of the metric.
currentMetricData_value :: Lens' CurrentMetricData (Maybe Double)

-- | Contains information about a set of real-time metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCurrentMetricResult</a> smart constructor.
data CurrentMetricResult
CurrentMetricResult' :: Maybe [CurrentMetricData] -> Maybe Dimensions -> CurrentMetricResult

-- | The set of metrics.
[$sel:collections:CurrentMetricResult'] :: CurrentMetricResult -> Maybe [CurrentMetricData]

-- | The dimensions for the metrics.
[$sel:dimensions:CurrentMetricResult'] :: CurrentMetricResult -> Maybe Dimensions

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:collections:CurrentMetricResult'</a>,
--   <a>currentMetricResult_collections</a> - The set of metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:CurrentMetricResult'</a>,
--   <a>currentMetricResult_dimensions</a> - The dimensions for the
--   metrics.
newCurrentMetricResult :: CurrentMetricResult

-- | The set of metrics.
currentMetricResult_collections :: Lens' CurrentMetricResult (Maybe [CurrentMetricData])

-- | The dimensions for the metrics.
currentMetricResult_dimensions :: Lens' CurrentMetricResult (Maybe Dimensions)

-- | Contains information about the dimensions for a set of metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDimensions</a> smart constructor.
data Dimensions
Dimensions' :: Maybe QueueReference -> Maybe Channel -> Dimensions

-- | Information about the queue for which metrics are returned.
[$sel:queue:Dimensions'] :: Dimensions -> Maybe QueueReference

-- | The channel used for grouping and filters.
[$sel:channel:Dimensions'] :: Dimensions -> Maybe Channel

-- | Create a value of <a>Dimensions</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:queue:Dimensions'</a>, <a>dimensions_queue</a> - Information
--   about the queue for which metrics are returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channel:Dimensions'</a>, <a>dimensions_channel</a> - The
--   channel used for grouping and filters.
newDimensions :: Dimensions

-- | Information about the queue for which metrics are returned.
dimensions_queue :: Lens' Dimensions (Maybe QueueReference)

-- | The channel used for grouping and filters.
dimensions_channel :: Lens' Dimensions (Maybe Channel)

-- | Contains the filter to apply when retrieving metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFilters</a> smart constructor.
data Filters
Filters' :: Maybe [Channel] -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Filters

-- | The channel to use to filter the metrics.
[$sel:channels:Filters'] :: Filters -> Maybe [Channel]

-- | The queues to use to filter the metrics. You can specify up to 100
--   queues per request.
[$sel:queues:Filters'] :: Filters -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>Filters</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channels:Filters'</a>, <a>filters_channels</a> - The channel
--   to use to filter the metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queues:Filters'</a>, <a>filters_queues</a> - The queues to use
--   to filter the metrics. You can specify up to 100 queues per request.
newFilters :: Filters

-- | The channel to use to filter the metrics.
filters_channels :: Lens' Filters (Maybe [Channel])

-- | The queues to use to filter the metrics. You can specify up to 100
--   queues per request.
filters_queues :: Lens' Filters (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | Contains information about a historical metric. For a description of

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHistoricalMetric</a> smart constructor.

data Instance
Instance' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe DirectoryType -> Maybe InstanceStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe InstanceStatusReason -> Instance

[$sel:instanceAlias:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

[$sel:serviceRole:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

[$sel:outboundCallsEnabled:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Bool

[$sel:arn:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

[$sel:identityManagementType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe DirectoryType

-- | The state of the instance.
[$sel:instanceStatus:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe InstanceStatus

--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:id:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | When the instance was created.
[$sel:createdTime:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Whether inbound calls are enabled.
[$sel:inboundCallsEnabled:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Bool

-- | Relevant details why the instance was not successfully created.
[$sel:statusReason:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe InstanceStatusReason

[$sel:id:InstanceSummary'] :: InstanceSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains information about which channels are supported, and how many
--   contacts an agent can have on a channel simultaneously.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMediaConcurrency</a> smart constructor.
data MediaConcurrency
MediaConcurrency' :: Channel -> Natural -> MediaConcurrency

-- | The channels that agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel
--   (CCP).
[$sel:channel:MediaConcurrency'] :: MediaConcurrency -> Channel

-- | The number of contacts an agent can have on a channel simultaneously.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>VOICE</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   1.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>CHAT</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>TASK</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
[$sel:concurrency:MediaConcurrency'] :: MediaConcurrency -> Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>MediaConcurrency</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channel:MediaConcurrency'</a>, <a>mediaConcurrency_channel</a>
--   - The channels that agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel
--   (CCP).
--   
--   <a>$sel:concurrency:MediaConcurrency'</a>,
--   <a>mediaConcurrency_concurrency</a> - The number of contacts an agent
--   can have on a channel simultaneously.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>VOICE</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   1.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>CHAT</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>TASK</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
newMediaConcurrency :: Channel -> Natural -> MediaConcurrency

-- | The channels that agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel
--   (CCP).

-- | The number of contacts an agent can have on a channel simultaneously.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>VOICE</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   1.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>CHAT</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>TASK</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.

-- | Contains information about a queue.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newQueue</a> smart constructor.
data Queue

-- | The maximum number of contacts that can be in the queue before it is
--   considered full.
[$sel:maxContacts:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe Natural

-- | The status of the queue.
[$sel:status:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe QueueStatus

-- | The identifier for the queue.
[$sel:queueId:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the queue.
[$sel:name:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the queue.
[$sel:queueArn:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The description of the queue.
[$sel:description:Queue'] :: Queue -> Maybe Text

--   QUEUE.

--   create a quick connect, you are prompted to assign one of the
--   following types: Agent (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue
--   (QUEUE).

--   is required only if QuickConnectType is PHONE_NUMBER.

-- | A link that an agent selects to complete a given task. You can have up

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newReference</a> smart constructor.

--   (CCP)

--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Reference'</a>, <a>reference_type</a> - A valid URL.

--   (CCP)

reference_type :: Lens' Reference ReferenceType

routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_queueArn :: Lens' RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary Text

-- | The name of the queue.
routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_queueName :: Lens' RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary Text

-- | The order in which contacts are to be handled for the queue. For more
--   information, see <a>Queues: priority and delay</a>.
routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_priority :: Lens' RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary Natural

-- | The delay, in seconds, that a contact should be in the queue before
--   they are routed to an available agent. For more information, see
--   <a>Queues: priority and delay</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect
--   Administrator Guide</i>.
routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_delay :: Lens' RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary Natural

-- | The channels this queue supports.
routingProfileQueueConfigSummary_channel :: Lens' RoutingProfileQueueConfigSummary Channel

--   this routing profile.

-- | Contains information about the threshold for service level metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newThreshold</a> smart constructor.
data Threshold

-- | The type of comparison. Only "less than" (LT) comparisons are
--   supported.
[$sel:comparison:Threshold'] :: Threshold -> Maybe Comparison

-- | Create a value of <a>Threshold</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:thresholdValue:Threshold'</a>, <a>threshold_thresholdValue</a>
--   - The threshold value to compare.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparison:Threshold'</a>, <a>threshold_comparison</a> - The
--   type of comparison. Only "less than" (LT) comparisons are supported.
newThreshold :: Threshold

-- | The threshold value to compare.
threshold_thresholdValue :: Lens' Threshold (Maybe Double)

-- | The type of comparison. Only "less than" (LT) comparisons are
--   supported.
threshold_comparison :: Lens' Threshold (Maybe Comparison)

-- | Contains information about a user account for a Amazon Connect
--   instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUser</a> smart constructor.
data User
User' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe UserIdentityInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe UserPhoneConfig -> Maybe Text -> User

-- | The identifiers of the security profiles for the user.
[$sel:securityProfileIds:User'] :: User -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | Information about the user identity.
[$sel:identityInfo:User'] :: User -> Maybe UserIdentityInfo

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the user account.
[$sel:arn:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the user account.
[$sel:id:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the hierarchy group for the user.
[$sel:hierarchyGroupId:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the user account in the directory used for identity
--   management.
[$sel:directoryUserId:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the routing profile for the user.
[$sel:routingProfileId:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | The tags.
[$sel:tags:User'] :: User -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | Information about the phone configuration for the user.
[$sel:phoneConfig:User'] :: User -> Maybe UserPhoneConfig

-- | The user name assigned to the user account.
[$sel:username:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>User</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   The identifiers of the security profiles for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityInfo:User'</a>, <a>user_identityInfo</a> - Information
--   about the user identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:User'</a>, <a>user_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the user account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:User'</a>, <a>user_id</a> - The identifier of the user
--   account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hierarchyGroupId:User'</a>, <a>user_hierarchyGroupId</a> - The
--   identifier of the hierarchy group for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:directoryUserId:User'</a>, <a>user_directoryUserId</a> - The
--   identifier of the user account in the directory used for identity
--   management.
--   
--   <a>$sel:routingProfileId:User'</a>, <a>user_routingProfileId</a> - The
--   identifier of the routing profile for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:User'</a>, <a>user_tags</a> - The tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneConfig:User'</a>, <a>user_phoneConfig</a> - Information
--   about the phone configuration for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:User'</a>, <a>user_username</a> - The user name
--   assigned to the user account.
newUser :: User

user_phoneConfig :: Lens' User (Maybe UserPhoneConfig)

-- | The user name assigned to the user account.
user_username :: Lens' User (Maybe Text)

--

data UserIdentityInfo

--   include this parameter, an error is returned.

-- | The last name. This is required if you are using Amazon Connect or
--   SAML for identity management.
[$sel:lastName:UserIdentityInfo'] :: UserIdentityInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The first name. This is required if you are using Amazon Connect or
--   SAML for identity management.

--   if you are using Amazon Connect or SAML for identity management.

-- | Adds the specified tags to the specified resource.
--   
--   The supported resource types are users, routing profiles, queues,
--   quick connects, contact flows, agent status, and hours of operation.
--   
--   For sample policies that use tags, see <a>Amazon Connect
--   Identity-Based Policy Examples</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect
--   Administrator Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Connect.TagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResource</a> smart constructor.
data TagResource
TagResource' :: Text -> HashMap Text Text -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
[$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> Text

-- | One or more tags. For example, { "tags": {"key1":"value1",
--   "key2":"value2"} }.
[$sel:tags:TagResource'] :: TagResource -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResource</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceArn:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_resourceArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:TagResource'</a>, <a>tagResource_tags</a> - One or more
--   tags. For example, { "tags": {"key1":"value1", "key2":"value2"} }.
newTagResource :: Text -> TagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
tagResource_resourceArn :: Lens' TagResource Text

-- | One or more tags. For example, { "tags": {"key1":"value1",
--   "key2":"value2"} }.
tagResource_tags :: Lens' TagResource (HashMap Text Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newTagResourceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data TagResourceResponse
TagResourceResponse' :: TagResourceResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>TagResourceResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newTagResourceResponse :: TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.TagResource.TagResource
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.TagResource.TagResourceResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.TagResource.TagResourceResponse

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Connect.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Connect.TagResource.TagResource
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Connect.TagResource.TagResource


-- | When a contact is being recorded, this API suspends recording the
--   call. For example, you might suspend the call recording while
--   collecting sensitive information, such as a credit card number. Then
--   use ResumeContactRecording to restart recording.
--   
--   The period of time that the recording is suspended is filled with
--   silence in the final recording.
--   
--   Only voice recordings are supported at this time.
module Network.AWS.Connect.SuspendContactRecording

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSuspendContactRecording</a> smart constructor.
data SuspendContactRecording
SuspendContactRecording' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> SuspendContactRecording

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:SuspendContactRecording'] :: SuspendContactRecording -> Text

-- | The identifier of the contact.
[$sel:contactId:SuspendContactRecording'] :: SuspendContactRecording -> Text

-- | The identifier of the contact. This is the identifier of the contact
--   associated with the first interaction with the contact center.
[$sel:initialContactId:SuspendContactRecording'] :: SuspendContactRecording -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SuspendContactRecording</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:SuspendContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>suspendContactRecording_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the
--   Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:SuspendContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>suspendContactRecording_contactId</a> - The identifier of the
--   contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:initialContactId:SuspendContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>suspendContactRecording_initialContactId</a> - The identifier of
--   the contact. This is the identifier of the contact associated with the
--   first interaction with the contact center.
newSuspendContactRecording :: Text -> Text -> Text -> SuspendContactRecording

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
suspendContactRecording_instanceId :: Lens' SuspendContactRecording Text

-- | The identifier of the contact.
suspendContactRecording_contactId :: Lens' SuspendContactRecording Text

-- | The identifier of the contact. This is the identifier of the contact
--   associated with the first interaction with the contact center.
suspendContactRecording_initialContactId :: Lens' SuspendContactRecording Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSuspendContactRecordingResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data SuspendContactRecordingResponse
SuspendContactRecordingResponse' :: Int -> SuspendContactRecordingResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SuspendContactRecordingResponse'] :: SuspendContactRecordingResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>SuspendContactRecordingResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:SuspendContactRecordingResponse'</a>,
--   <a>suspendContactRecordingResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's
--   http status code.
newSuspendContactRecordingResponse :: Int -> SuspendContactRecordingResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
suspendContactRecordingResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SuspendContactRecordingResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.SuspendContactRecording.SuspendContactRecording

instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.SuspendContactRecording.SuspendContactRecording

-- | Stops recording a call when a contact is being recorded.
--   StopContactRecording is a one-time action. If you use
--   StopContactRecording to stop recording an ongoing call, you can't use
--   StartContactRecording to restart it. For scenarios where the recording
--   has started and you want to suspend it for sensitive information (for
--   example, to collect a credit card number), and then restart it, use
--   SuspendContactRecording and ResumeContactRecording.
--   
--   Only voice recordings are supported at this time.
module Network.AWS.Connect.StopContactRecording

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStopContactRecording</a> smart constructor.
data StopContactRecording
StopContactRecording' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> StopContactRecording

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:StopContactRecording'] :: StopContactRecording -> Text

-- | The identifier of the contact.
[$sel:contactId:StopContactRecording'] :: StopContactRecording -> Text

-- | The identifier of the contact. This is the identifier of the contact
--   associated with the first interaction with the contact center.
[$sel:initialContactId:StopContactRecording'] :: StopContactRecording -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StopContactRecording</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:StopContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>stopContactRecording_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:StopContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>stopContactRecording_contactId</a> - The identifier of the contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:initialContactId:StopContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>stopContactRecording_initialContactId</a> - The identifier of the
--   contact. This is the identifier of the contact associated with the
--   first interaction with the contact center.
newStopContactRecording :: Text -> Text -> Text -> StopContactRecording

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
stopContactRecording_instanceId :: Lens' StopContactRecording Text

-- | The identifier of the contact.
stopContactRecording_contactId :: Lens' StopContactRecording Text

-- | The identifier of the contact. This is the identifier of the contact
--   associated with the first interaction with the contact center.
stopContactRecording_initialContactId :: Lens' StopContactRecording Text

-- | Initiates a contact flow to start a new task.
module Network.AWS.Connect.StartTaskContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartTaskContact</a> smart constructor.
data StartTaskContact
StartTaskContact' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Reference) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StartTaskContact

-- | The identifier of the previous chat, voice, or task contact.
[$sel:previousContactId:StartTaskContact'] :: StartTaskContact -> Maybe Text

-- | A formatted URL that is shown to an agent in the Contact Control Panel
--   (CCP).
[$sel:references:StartTaskContact'] :: StartTaskContact -> Maybe (HashMap Text Reference)

-- | A custom key-value pair using an attribute map. The attributes are
--   standard Amazon Connect attributes, and can be accessed in contact
--   flows just like any other contact attributes.
--   
--   There can be up to 32,768 UTF-8 bytes across all key-value pairs per
--   contact. Attribute keys can include only alphanumeric, dash, and
--   underscore characters.
[$sel:attributes:StartTaskContact'] :: StartTaskContact -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A description of the task that is shown to an agent in the Contact
--   Control Panel (CCP).
[$sel:description:StartTaskContact'] :: StartTaskContact -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
[$sel:clientToken:StartTaskContact'] :: StartTaskContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:StartTaskContact'] :: StartTaskContact -> Text

-- | The identifier of the contact flow for initiating the tasks. To see
--   the ContactFlowId in the Amazon Connect console user interface, on the
--   navigation menu go to <b>Routing</b>, <b>Contact Flows</b>. Choose the
--   contact flow. On the contact flow page, under the name of the contact
--   flow, choose <b>Show additional flow information</b>. The
--   ContactFlowId is the last part of the ARN, shown here in bold:
--   
--   
--   arn:aws:connect:us-west-2:xxxxxxxxxxxx:instance/xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx/contact-flow/<b>846ec553-a005-41c0-8341-xxxxxxxxxxxx</b>
[$sel:contactFlowId:StartTaskContact'] :: StartTaskContact -> Text

-- | The name of a task that is shown to an agent in the Contact Control
--   Panel (CCP).
[$sel:name:StartTaskContact'] :: StartTaskContact -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartTaskContact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:previousContactId:StartTaskContact'</a>,
--   <a>startTaskContact_previousContactId</a> - The identifier of the
--   previous chat, voice, or task contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:references:StartTaskContact'</a>,
--   <a>startTaskContact_references</a> - A formatted URL that is shown to
--   an agent in the Contact Control Panel (CCP).
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:StartTaskContact'</a>,
--   <a>startTaskContact_attributes</a> - A custom key-value pair using an
--   attribute map. The attributes are standard Amazon Connect attributes,
--   and can be accessed in contact flows just like any other contact
--   attributes.
--   
--   There can be up to 32,768 UTF-8 bytes across all key-value pairs per
--   contact. Attribute keys can include only alphanumeric, dash, and
--   underscore characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:StartTaskContact'</a>,
--   <a>startTaskContact_description</a> - A description of the task that
--   is shown to an agent in the Contact Control Panel (CCP).
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:StartTaskContact'</a>,
--   <a>startTaskContact_clientToken</a> - A unique, case-sensitive
--   identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:StartTaskContact'</a>,
--   <a>startTaskContact_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.

--   <a>$sel:contactFlowId:StartTaskContact'</a>,

--   flow for initiating the tasks. To see the ContactFlowId in the Amazon
--   Connect console user interface, on the navigation menu go to
--   <b>Routing</b>, <b>Contact Flows</b>. Choose the contact flow. On the

--   (CCP).
newStartTaskContact :: Text -> Text -> Text -> StartTaskContact

--   flows just like any other contact attributes.

-- | Places an outbound call to a contact, and then initiates the contact
--   flow. It performs the actions in the contact flow that's specified (in
--   <tt>ContactFlowId</tt>).
--   
--   Agents do not initiate the outbound API, which means that they do not
--   dial the contact. If the contact flow places an outbound call to a
--   contact, and then puts the contact in queue, the call is then routed
--   to the agent, like any other inbound case.
--   
--   There is a 60-second dialing timeout for this operation. If the call
--   is not connected after 60 seconds, it fails.
--   
--   UK numbers with a 447 prefix are not allowed by default. Before you
--   can dial these UK mobile numbers, you must submit a service quota
--   increase request. For more information, see <a>Amazon Connect Service
--   Quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   Campaign calls are not allowed by default. Before you can make a call
--   with <tt>TrafficType</tt> = <tt>CAMPAIGN</tt>, you must submit a
--   service quota increase request. For more information, see <a>Amazon
--   Connect Service Quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator
--   Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Connect.StartOutboundVoiceContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartOutboundVoiceContact</a> smart constructor.
data StartOutboundVoiceContact
StartOutboundVoiceContact' :: Maybe AnswerMachineDetectionConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TrafficType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StartOutboundVoiceContact

-- | Configuration of the answering machine detection for this outbound
--   call.
[$sel:answerMachineDetectionConfig:StartOutboundVoiceContact'] :: StartOutboundVoiceContact -> Maybe AnswerMachineDetectionConfig

-- | The queue for the call. If you specify a queue, the phone displayed
--   for caller ID is the phone number specified in the queue. If you do
--   not specify a queue, the queue defined in the contact flow is used. If
--   you do not specify a queue, you must specify a source phone number.
[$sel:queueId:StartOutboundVoiceContact'] :: StartOutboundVoiceContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The campaign identifier of the outbound communication.
[$sel:campaignId:StartOutboundVoiceContact'] :: StartOutboundVoiceContact -> Maybe Text

-- | Denotes the class of traffic. Calls with different traffic types are
--   handled differently by Amazon Connect. The default value is
--   <tt>GENERAL</tt>. Use <tt>CAMPAIGN</tt> if
--   <tt>EnableAnswerMachineDetection</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>. For all
--   other cases, use <tt>GENERAL</tt>.
[$sel:trafficType:StartOutboundVoiceContact'] :: StartOutboundVoiceContact -> Maybe TrafficType

-- | The phone number associated with the Amazon Connect instance, in E.164
--   format. If you do not specify a source phone number, you must specify
--   a queue.
[$sel:sourcePhoneNumber:StartOutboundVoiceContact'] :: StartOutboundVoiceContact -> Maybe Text

-- | A custom key-value pair using an attribute map. The attributes are

--   creation. If a contact is already started, the contact ID is returned.

-- | Starts recording the contact when the agent joins the call.
--   StartContactRecording is a one-time action. For example, if you use
--   StopContactRecording to stop recording an ongoing call, you can't use
--   StartContactRecording to restart it. For scenarios where the recording
--   has started and you want to suspend and resume it, such as when
--   collecting sensitive information (for example, a credit card number),
--   use SuspendContactRecording and ResumeContactRecording.
--   
--   You can use this API to override the recording behavior configured in
--   the <a>Set recording behavior</a> block.
--   
--   Only voice recordings are supported at this time.
module Network.AWS.Connect.StartContactRecording

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartContactRecording</a> smart constructor.
data StartContactRecording
StartContactRecording' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> VoiceRecordingConfiguration -> StartContactRecording

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:StartContactRecording'] :: StartContactRecording -> Text

-- | The identifier of the contact.
[$sel:contactId:StartContactRecording'] :: StartContactRecording -> Text

-- | The identifier of the contact. This is the identifier of the contact
--   associated with the first interaction with the contact center.
[$sel:initialContactId:StartContactRecording'] :: StartContactRecording -> Text

-- | The person being recorded.
[$sel:voiceRecordingConfiguration:StartContactRecording'] :: StartContactRecording -> VoiceRecordingConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>StartContactRecording</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:StartContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>startContactRecording_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:StartContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>startContactRecording_contactId</a> - The identifier of the
--   contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:initialContactId:StartContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>startContactRecording_initialContactId</a> - The identifier of the
--   contact. This is the identifier of the contact associated with the
--   first interaction with the contact center.
--   
--   <a>$sel:voiceRecordingConfiguration:StartContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>startContactRecording_voiceRecordingConfiguration</a> - The person
--   being recorded.
newStartContactRecording :: Text -> Text -> Text -> VoiceRecordingConfiguration -> StartContactRecording

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
startContactRecording_instanceId :: Lens' StartContactRecording Text

-- | The identifier of the contact.
startContactRecording_contactId :: Lens' StartContactRecording Text

-- | The identifier of the contact. This is the identifier of the contact
--   associated with the first interaction with the contact center.
startContactRecording_initialContactId :: Lens' StartContactRecording Text

-- | The person being recorded.
startContactRecording_voiceRecordingConfiguration :: Lens' StartContactRecording VoiceRecordingConfiguration

-- | Initiates a contact flow to start a new chat for the customer.
--   Response of this API provides a token required to obtain credentials
--   from the <a>CreateParticipantConnection</a> API in the Amazon Connect
--   Participant Service.
--   
--   When a new chat contact is successfully created, clients must
--   subscribe to the participants connection for the created chat within
--   5 minutes. This is achieved by invoking
--   <a>CreateParticipantConnection</a> with WEBSOCKET and
--   CONNECTION_CREDENTIALS.
--   
--   A 429 error occurs in two situations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>API rate limit is exceeded. API TPS throttling returns a
--   <tt>TooManyRequests</tt> exception.</li>
--   <li>The <a>quota for concurrent active chats</a> is exceeded. Active
--   chat throttling returns a <tt>LimitExceededException</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about chat, see <a>Chat</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Connect.StartChatContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartChatContact</a> smart constructor.
data StartChatContact
StartChatContact' :: Maybe ChatMessage -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> ParticipantDetails -> StartChatContact

-- | The initial message to be sent to the newly created chat.
[$sel:initialMessage:StartChatContact'] :: StartChatContact -> Maybe ChatMessage

-- | A custom key-value pair using an attribute map. The attributes are
--   standard Amazon Connect attributes. They can be accessed in contact
--   flows just like any other contact attributes.
--   
--   There can be up to 32,768 UTF-8 bytes across all key-value pairs per
--   contact. Attribute keys can include only alphanumeric, dash, and
--   underscore characters.
[$sel:attributes:StartChatContact'] :: StartChatContact -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
[$sel:clientToken:StartChatContact'] :: StartChatContact -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:StartChatContact'] :: StartChatContact -> Text

-- | The identifier of the contact flow for initiating the chat. To see the
--   ContactFlowId in the Amazon Connect console user interface, on the
--   navigation menu go to <b>Routing</b>, <b>Contact Flows</b>. Choose the
--   contact flow. On the contact flow page, under the name of the contact
--   flow, choose <b>Show additional flow information</b>. The
--   ContactFlowId is the last part of the ARN, shown here in bold:
--   
--   
--   arn:aws:connect:us-west-2:xxxxxxxxxxxx:instance/xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx/contact-flow/<b>846ec553-a005-41c0-8341-xxxxxxxxxxxx</b>
[$sel:contactFlowId:StartChatContact'] :: StartChatContact -> Text

-- | Information identifying the participant.
[$sel:participantDetails:StartChatContact'] :: StartChatContact -> ParticipantDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>StartChatContact</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:initialMessage:StartChatContact'</a>,

--   sent to the newly created chat.

--   <a>$sel:attributes:StartChatContact'</a>,
--   <a>startChatContact_attributes</a> - A custom key-value pair using an
--   attribute map. The attributes are standard Amazon Connect attributes.
--   They can be accessed in contact flows just like any other contact
--   attributes.
--   
--   There can be up to 32,768 UTF-8 bytes across all key-value pairs per
--   contact. Attribute keys can include only alphanumeric, dash, and
--   underscore characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:StartChatContact'</a>,
--   <a>startChatContact_clientToken</a> - A unique, case-sensitive
--   identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:StartChatContact'</a>,
--   <a>startChatContact_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.

--   flow for initiating the chat. To see the ContactFlowId in the Amazon

--   <b>Routing</b>, <b>Contact Flows</b>. Choose the contact flow. On the

--   the ARN, shown here in bold:
--

--   chat participant. The participantId for a chat participant is the same
--   throughout the chat lifecycle.
--

-- | When a contact is being recorded, and the recording has been suspended
--   using SuspendContactRecording, this API resumes recording the call.
--   
--   Only voice recordings are supported at this time.
module Network.AWS.Connect.ResumeContactRecording

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newResumeContactRecording</a> smart constructor.
data ResumeContactRecording
ResumeContactRecording' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResumeContactRecording

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:ResumeContactRecording'] :: ResumeContactRecording -> Text

-- | The identifier of the contact.
[$sel:contactId:ResumeContactRecording'] :: ResumeContactRecording -> Text

-- | The identifier of the contact. This is the identifier of the contact
--   associated with the first interaction with the contact center.
[$sel:initialContactId:ResumeContactRecording'] :: ResumeContactRecording -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResumeContactRecording</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:ResumeContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>resumeContactRecording_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the
--   Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactId:ResumeContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>resumeContactRecording_contactId</a> - The identifier of the
--   contact.
--   
--   <a>$sel:initialContactId:ResumeContactRecording'</a>,
--   <a>resumeContactRecording_initialContactId</a> - The identifier of the
--   contact. This is the identifier of the contact associated with the
--   first interaction with the contact center.
newResumeContactRecording :: Text -> Text -> Text -> ResumeContactRecording

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
resumeContactRecording_instanceId :: Lens' ResumeContactRecording Text

-- | The identifier of the contact.
resumeContactRecording_contactId :: Lens' ResumeContactRecording Text

-- | The identifier of the contact. This is the identifier of the contact
--   associated with the first interaction with the contact center.
resumeContactRecording_initialContactId :: Lens' ResumeContactRecording Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newResumeContactRecordingResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ResumeContactRecordingResponse

--   Connect instance.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Connect.ListUsers

data ListUsers

--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.

--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.

--   in the ARN of the instance.

--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.

-- | Provides information about the quick connects for the specified Amazon
--   Connect instance.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | The type of quick connect. In the Amazon Connect console, when you
--   create a quick connect, you are prompted to assign one of the
--   following types: Agent (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue
--   (QUEUE).
[$sel:quickConnectTypes:ListQuickConnects'] :: ListQuickConnects -> Maybe [QuickConnectType]

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:ListQuickConnects'] :: ListQuickConnects -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListQuickConnects</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListQuickConnects'</a>,
--   <a>listQuickConnects_nextToken</a> - The token for the next set of
--   results. Use the value returned in the previous response in the next
--   request to retrieve the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListQuickConnects'</a>,
--   <a>listQuickConnects_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results to
--   return per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:quickConnectTypes:ListQuickConnects'</a>,
--   <a>listQuickConnects_quickConnectTypes</a> - The type of quick
--   connect. In the Amazon Connect console, when you create a quick
--   connect, you are prompted to assign one of the following types: Agent
--   (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue (QUEUE).
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:ListQuickConnects'</a>,
--   <a>listQuickConnects_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
newListQuickConnects :: Text -> ListQuickConnects

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
listQuickConnects_nextToken :: Lens' ListQuickConnects (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
listQuickConnects_maxResults :: Lens' ListQuickConnects (Maybe Natural)

-- | The type of quick connect. In the Amazon Connect console, when you
--   create a quick connect, you are prompted to assign one of the
--   following types: Agent (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue
--   (QUEUE).
listQuickConnects_quickConnectTypes :: Lens' ListQuickConnects (Maybe [QuickConnectType])

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
listQuickConnects_instanceId :: Lens' ListQuickConnects Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListQuickConnectsResponse</a> smart constructor.

-- | Provides information about the queues for the specified Amazon Connect
--   instance.
--   
--   If you do not specify a <tt>QueueTypes</tt> parameter, both standard
--   and agent queues are returned. This might cause an unexpected
--   truncation of results if you have more than 1000 agents and you limit
--   the number of results of the API call in code.
--   
--   For more information about queues, see <a>Queues: Standard and
--   Agent</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Connect.ListQueues

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListQueues</a> smart constructor.

--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.

--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--   about the phone numbers.

--   <a>listPhoneNumbersResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.

--   results.

-- | Information about the phone numbers.

-- | The response's http status code.

-- | This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and is subject to
--   change.
--   
--   Return a list of instances which are in active state,
--   creation-in-progress state, and failed state. Instances that aren't
--   successfully created (they are in a failed state) are returned only
--   for 24 hours after the CreateInstance API was invoked.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

--   change.

--   instance and resource type.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.

-- | Create a value of <a>ListInstanceStorageConfigs</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListInstanceStorageConfigs'</a>,
--   <a>listInstanceStorageConfigs_nextToken</a> - The token for the next
--   set of results. Use the value returned in the previous response in the
--   next request to retrieve the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListInstanceStorageConfigs'</a>,
--   <a>listInstanceStorageConfigs_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of
--   results to return per page.
--

--   <a>listInstanceStorageConfigs_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the
--   Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the

-- | This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and is subject to
--   change.
--   
--   For the specified version of Amazon Lex, returns a paginated list of
--   all the Amazon Lex bots currently associated with the instance.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Connect.ListBots

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListBots</a> smart constructor.
data ListBots
ListBots' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> LexVersion -> ListBots

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListBots'] :: ListBots -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
[$sel:maxResults:ListBots'] :: ListBots -> Maybe Natural

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:ListBots'] :: ListBots -> Text

-- | The version of Amazon Lex or Amazon Lex V2.
[$sel:lexVersion:ListBots'] :: ListBots -> LexVersion

-- | Create a value of <a>ListBots</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListBots'</a>, <a>listBots_nextToken</a> - The token
--   for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the previous
--   response in the next request to retrieve the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListBots'</a>, <a>listBots_maxResults</a> - The
--   maximum number of results to return per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:ListBots'</a>, <a>listBots_instanceId</a> - The
--   identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instanceId
--   in the ARN of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lexVersion:ListBots'</a>, <a>listBots_lexVersion</a> - The
--   version of Amazon Lex or Amazon Lex V2.
newListBots :: Text -> LexVersion -> ListBots

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
listBots_nextToken :: Lens' ListBots (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
listBots_maxResults :: Lens' ListBots (Maybe Natural)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
listBots_instanceId :: Lens' ListBots Text

listBots_lexVersion :: Lens' ListBots LexVersion

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListBotsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListBotsResponse
ListBotsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [LexBotConfig] -> Int -> ListBotsResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListBotsResponse'] :: ListBotsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The names and Regions of the Amazon Lex or Amazon Lex V2 bots
--   associated with the specified instance.
[$sel:lexBots:ListBotsResponse'] :: ListBotsResponse -> Maybe [LexBotConfig]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListBotsResponse'] :: ListBotsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ListBotsResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListBots'</a>, <a>listBotsResponse_nextToken</a> -
--   If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lexBots:ListBotsResponse'</a>, <a>listBotsResponse_lexBots</a>
--   - The names and Regions of the Amazon Lex or Amazon Lex V2 bots
--   associated with the specified instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListBotsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listBotsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status code.
newListBotsResponse :: Int -> ListBotsResponse

--   results.

-- | The names and Regions of the Amazon Lex or Amazon Lex V2 bots
--   associated with the specified instance.
listBotsResponse_lexBots :: Lens' ListBotsResponse (Maybe [LexBotConfig])

-- | The response's http status code.
listBotsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' ListBotsResponse Int
