-- | Gets historical metric data from the specified Amazon Connect
--   instance.
--   
--   For a description of each historical metric, see <a>Historical Metrics
--   Definitions</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetMetricData</a> smart constructor.
data GetMetricData
GetMetricData' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Grouping] -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> Filters -> [HistoricalMetric] -> GetMetricData

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:GetMetricData'] :: GetMetricData -> Maybe Text

-- | The grouping applied to the metrics returned. For example, when
--   results are grouped by queue, the metrics returned are grouped by
--   queue. The values returned apply to the metrics for each queue rather
--   than aggregated for all queues.
--   
--   If no grouping is specified, a summary of metrics for all queues is
--   returned.
[$sel:groupings:GetMetricData'] :: GetMetricData -> Maybe [Grouping]

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
[$sel:maxResults:GetMetricData'] :: GetMetricData -> Maybe Natural

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:GetMetricData'] :: GetMetricData -> Text

-- | The timestamp, in UNIX Epoch time format, at which to start the
--   reporting interval for the retrieval of historical metrics data. The
--   time must be specified using a multiple of 5 minutes, such as 10:05,
--   10:10, 10:15.
--   
--   The start time cannot be earlier than 24 hours before the time of the
--   request. Historical metrics are available only for 24 hours.
[$sel:startTime:GetMetricData'] :: GetMetricData -> POSIX

-- | The timestamp, in UNIX Epoch time format, at which to end the
--   reporting interval for the retrieval of historical metrics data. The
--   time must be specified using an interval of 5 minutes, such as 11:00,
--   11:05, 11:10, and must be later than the start time timestamp.
--   
--   The time range between the start and end time must be less than 24
--   hours.
[$sel:endTime:GetMetricData'] :: GetMetricData -> POSIX

-- | The queues, up to 100, or channels, to use to filter the metrics
--   returned. Metric data is retrieved only for the resources associated
--   with the queues or channels included in the filter. You can include
--   both queue IDs and queue ARNs in the same request. VOICE, CHAT, and
--   TASK channels are supported.
--   
--   To filter by <tt>Queues</tt>, enter the queue ID/ARN, not the name of
--   the queue.
[$sel:filters:GetMetricData'] :: GetMetricData -> Filters

-- | The metrics to retrieve. Specify the name, unit, and statistic for
--   each metric. The following historical metrics are available. For a
--   description of each metric, see <a>Historical Metrics Definitions</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   This API does not support a contacts incoming metric (there's no
--   CONTACTS_INCOMING metric missing from the documented list).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>ABANDON_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>AFTER_CONTACT_WORK_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>API_CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CALLBACK_CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_ABANDONED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_AGENT_HUNG_UP_FIRST</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_CONSULTED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED_INCOMING</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED_OUTBOUND</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HOLD_ABANDONS</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_MISSED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_QUEUED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_IN</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_IN_FROM_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic:
--   SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_OUT</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_OUT_FROM_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic:
--   SUM</li>
--   <li><i>HANDLE_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>HOLD_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>INTERACTION_AND_HOLD_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>INTERACTION_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>OCCUPANCY</i> Unit: PERCENTStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>QUEUE_ANSWER_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>QUEUED_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: MAX</li>
--   <li><i>SERVICE_LEVEL</i> You can include up to 20 SERVICE_LEVEL
--   metrics in a request.Unit: PERCENTStatistic: AVGThreshold: For
--   <tt>ThresholdValue</tt>, enter any whole number from 1 to 604800
--   (inclusive), in seconds. For <tt>Comparison</tt>, you must enter
--   <tt>LT</tt> (for "Less than").</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:historicalMetrics:GetMetricData'] :: GetMetricData -> [HistoricalMetric]

-- | Create a value of <a>GetMetricData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_nextToken</a> -
--   The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupings:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_groupings</a> -
--   The grouping applied to the metrics returned. For example, when
--   results are grouped by queue, the metrics returned are grouped by
--   queue. The values returned apply to the metrics for each queue rather
--   than aggregated for all queues.
--   
--   If no grouping is specified, a summary of metrics for all queues is
--   returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_maxResults</a>
--   - The maximum number of results to return per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_instanceId</a>
--   - The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_startTime</a> -
--   The timestamp, in UNIX Epoch time format, at which to start the
--   reporting interval for the retrieval of historical metrics data. The
--   time must be specified using a multiple of 5 minutes, such as 10:05,
--   10:10, 10:15.
--   
--   The start time cannot be earlier than 24 hours before the time of the
--   request. Historical metrics are available only for 24 hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_endTime</a> - The
--   timestamp, in UNIX Epoch time format, at which to end the reporting
--   interval for the retrieval of historical metrics data. The time must
--   be specified using an interval of 5 minutes, such as 11:00, 11:05,
--   11:10, and must be later than the start time timestamp.
--   
--   The time range between the start and end time must be less than 24
--   hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_filters</a> - The
--   queues, up to 100, or channels, to use to filter the metrics returned.
--   Metric data is retrieved only for the resources associated with the
--   queues or channels included in the filter. You can include both queue
--   IDs and queue ARNs in the same request. VOICE, CHAT, and TASK channels
--   are supported.
--   
--   To filter by <tt>Queues</tt>, enter the queue ID/ARN, not the name of
--   the queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:historicalMetrics:GetMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getMetricData_historicalMetrics</a> - The metrics to retrieve.
--   Specify the name, unit, and statistic for each metric. The following
--   historical metrics are available. For a description of each metric,
--   see <a>Historical Metrics Definitions</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect
--   Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   This API does not support a contacts incoming metric (there's no
--   CONTACTS_INCOMING metric missing from the documented list).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>ABANDON_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>AFTER_CONTACT_WORK_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>API_CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CALLBACK_CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_ABANDONED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_AGENT_HUNG_UP_FIRST</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_CONSULTED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED_INCOMING</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED_OUTBOUND</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HOLD_ABANDONS</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_MISSED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_QUEUED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_IN</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_IN_FROM_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic:
--   SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_OUT</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_OUT_FROM_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic:
--   SUM</li>
--   <li><i>HANDLE_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>HOLD_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>INTERACTION_AND_HOLD_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>INTERACTION_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>OCCUPANCY</i> Unit: PERCENTStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>QUEUE_ANSWER_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>QUEUED_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: MAX</li>
--   <li><i>SERVICE_LEVEL</i> You can include up to 20 SERVICE_LEVEL
--   metrics in a request.Unit: PERCENTStatistic: AVGThreshold: For
--   <tt>ThresholdValue</tt>, enter any whole number from 1 to 604800
--   (inclusive), in seconds. For <tt>Comparison</tt>, you must enter
--   <tt>LT</tt> (for "Less than").</li>
--   </ul>
newGetMetricData :: Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> Filters -> GetMetricData

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
getMetricData_nextToken :: Lens' GetMetricData (Maybe Text)

-- | The grouping applied to the metrics returned. For example, when
--   results are grouped by queue, the metrics returned are grouped by
--   queue. The values returned apply to the metrics for each queue rather
--   than aggregated for all queues.
--   
--   If no grouping is specified, a summary of metrics for all queues is
--   returned.
getMetricData_groupings :: Lens' GetMetricData (Maybe [Grouping])

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
getMetricData_maxResults :: Lens' GetMetricData (Maybe Natural)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
getMetricData_instanceId :: Lens' GetMetricData Text

-- | The timestamp, in UNIX Epoch time format, at which to start the
--   reporting interval for the retrieval of historical metrics data. The
--   time must be specified using a multiple of 5 minutes, such as 10:05,
--   10:10, 10:15.
--   
--   The start time cannot be earlier than 24 hours before the time of the
--   request. Historical metrics are available only for 24 hours.
getMetricData_startTime :: Lens' GetMetricData UTCTime

-- | The timestamp, in UNIX Epoch time format, at which to end the
--   reporting interval for the retrieval of historical metrics data. The
--   time must be specified using an interval of 5 minutes, such as 11:00,
--   11:05, 11:10, and must be later than the start time timestamp.
--   
--   The time range between the start and end time must be less than 24
--   hours.
getMetricData_endTime :: Lens' GetMetricData UTCTime

-- | The queues, up to 100, or channels, to use to filter the metrics
--   returned. Metric data is retrieved only for the resources associated
--   with the queues or channels included in the filter. You can include
--   both queue IDs and queue ARNs in the same request. VOICE, CHAT, and
--   TASK channels are supported.
--   
--   To filter by <tt>Queues</tt>, enter the queue ID/ARN, not the name of
--   the queue.
getMetricData_filters :: Lens' GetMetricData Filters

-- | The metrics to retrieve. Specify the name, unit, and statistic for
--   each metric. The following historical metrics are available. For a
--   description of each metric, see <a>Historical Metrics Definitions</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   This API does not support a contacts incoming metric (there's no
--   CONTACTS_INCOMING metric missing from the documented list).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>ABANDON_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>AFTER_CONTACT_WORK_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>API_CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CALLBACK_CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_ABANDONED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_AGENT_HUNG_UP_FIRST</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_CONSULTED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED_INCOMING</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED_OUTBOUND</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HOLD_ABANDONS</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_MISSED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_QUEUED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_IN</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_IN_FROM_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic:
--   SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_OUT</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_OUT_FROM_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic:
--   SUM</li>
--   <li><i>HANDLE_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>HOLD_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>INTERACTION_AND_HOLD_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>INTERACTION_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>OCCUPANCY</i> Unit: PERCENTStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>QUEUE_ANSWER_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>QUEUED_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: MAX</li>
--   <li><i>SERVICE_LEVEL</i> You can include up to 20 SERVICE_LEVEL
--   metrics in a request.Unit: PERCENTStatistic: AVGThreshold: For
--   <tt>ThresholdValue</tt>, enter any whole number from 1 to 604800
--   (inclusive), in seconds. For <tt>Comparison</tt>, you must enter
--   <tt>LT</tt> (for "Less than").</li>
--   </ul>
getMetricData_historicalMetrics :: Lens' GetMetricData [HistoricalMetric]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetMetricDataResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetMetricDataResponse
GetMetricDataResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [HistoricalMetricResult] -> Int -> GetMetricDataResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
[$sel:nextToken:GetMetricDataResponse'] :: GetMetricDataResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the historical metrics.
--   
--   If no grouping is specified, a summary of metric data is returned.
[$sel:metricResults:GetMetricDataResponse'] :: GetMetricDataResponse -> Maybe [HistoricalMetricResult]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetMetricDataResponse'] :: GetMetricDataResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetMetricDataResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getMetricDataResponse_nextToken</a> - If there are additional
--   results, this is the token for the next set of results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricResults:GetMetricDataResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getMetricDataResponse_metricResults</a> - Information about the
--   historical metrics.
--   
--   If no grouping is specified, a summary of metric data is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetMetricDataResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getMetricDataResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetMetricDataResponse :: Int -> GetMetricDataResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
getMetricDataResponse_nextToken :: Lens' GetMetricDataResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the historical metrics.
--   
--   If no grouping is specified, a summary of metric data is returned.
getMetricDataResponse_metricResults :: Lens' GetMetricDataResponse (Maybe [HistoricalMetricResult])

-- | The response's http status code.
getMetricDataResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetMetricDataResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricDataResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricDataResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricDataResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricDataResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricDataResponse
instance Network.AWS.Pager.AWSPager Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Connect.GetMetricData.GetMetricData


-- | Retrieves a token for federation.
--   
--   This API doesn't support root users. If you try to invoke
--   GetFederationToken with root credentials, an error message similar to
--   the following one appears:
--   
--   <pre>
--   Provided identity: Principal: .... User: .... cannot be used for federation with Amazon Connect
--   </pre>
module Network.AWS.Connect.GetFederationToken

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetFederationToken</a> smart constructor.
data GetFederationToken
GetFederationToken' :: Text -> GetFederationToken

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:GetFederationToken'] :: GetFederationToken -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetFederationToken</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:GetFederationToken'</a>,
--   <a>getFederationToken_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
newGetFederationToken :: Text -> GetFederationToken

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
getFederationToken_instanceId :: Lens' GetFederationToken Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetFederationTokenResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetFederationTokenResponse
GetFederationTokenResponse' :: Maybe Credentials -> Int -> GetFederationTokenResponse

-- | The credentials to use for federation.
[$sel:credentials:GetFederationTokenResponse'] :: GetFederationTokenResponse -> Maybe Credentials

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetFederationTokenResponse'] :: GetFederationTokenResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetFederationTokenResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:credentials:GetFederationTokenResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getFederationTokenResponse_credentials</a> - The credentials to use
--   for federation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetFederationTokenResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getFederationTokenResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetFederationTokenResponse :: Int -> GetFederationTokenResponse

getFederationTokenResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetFederationTokenResponse Int

-- | Gets the real-time metric data from the specified Amazon Connect
--   instance.
--   
--   For a description of each metric, see <a>Real-time Metrics
--   Definitions</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Connect.GetCurrentMetricData

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetCurrentMetricData</a> smart constructor.
data GetCurrentMetricData
GetCurrentMetricData' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Grouping] -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> Filters -> [CurrentMetric] -> GetCurrentMetricData

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
[$sel:nextToken:GetCurrentMetricData'] :: GetCurrentMetricData -> Maybe Text

-- | The grouping applied to the metrics returned. For example, when
--   grouped by <tt>QUEUE</tt>, the metrics returned apply to each queue
--   rather than aggregated for all queues. If you group by
--   <tt>CHANNEL</tt>, you should include a Channels filter. VOICE, CHAT,
--   and TASK channels are supported.
--   
--   If no <tt>Grouping</tt> is included in the request, a summary of
--   metrics is returned.
[$sel:groupings:GetCurrentMetricData'] :: GetCurrentMetricData -> Maybe [Grouping]

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
[$sel:maxResults:GetCurrentMetricData'] :: GetCurrentMetricData -> Maybe Natural

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:GetCurrentMetricData'] :: GetCurrentMetricData -> Text

-- | The queues, up to 100, or channels, to use to filter the metrics
--   returned. Metric data is retrieved only for the resources associated
--   with the queues or channels included in the filter. You can include
--   both queue IDs and queue ARNs in the same request. VOICE, CHAT, and
--   TASK channels are supported.
[$sel:filters:GetCurrentMetricData'] :: GetCurrentMetricData -> Filters

-- | The metrics to retrieve. Specify the name and unit for each metric.
--   The following metrics are available. For a description of all the
--   metrics, see <a>Real-time Metrics Definitions</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_AFTER_CONTACT_WORK</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time
--   metrics report: <a>ACW</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_AVAILABLE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Available</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ERROR</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Error</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_NON_PRODUCTIVE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>NPT (Non-Productive Time)</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ON_CALL</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>On contact</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ON_CONTACT</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>On contact</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ONLINE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Online</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_STAFFED</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Staffed</a></li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_IN_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>In queue</a></li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_SCHEDULED</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Scheduled</a></li>
--   <li><i>OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE</i> Unit: SECONDSWhen you use groupings,
--   Unit says SECONDS and the Value is returned in SECONDS.When you do not
--   use groupings, Unit says SECONDS but the Value is returned in
--   MILLISECONDS. For example, if you get a response like this:<tt>{
--   "Metric": { "Name": "OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE", "Unit": "SECONDS" },
--   "Value": 24113.0 </tt>}The actual OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE is 24
--   seconds.Name in real-time metrics report: <a>Oldest</a></li>
--   <li><i>SLOTS_ACTIVE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Active</a></li>
--   <li><i>SLOTS_AVAILABLE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Availability</a></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:currentMetrics:GetCurrentMetricData'] :: GetCurrentMetricData -> [CurrentMetric]

-- | Create a value of <a>GetCurrentMetricData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_nextToken</a> - The token for the next set of
--   results. Use the value returned in the previous response in the next
--   request to retrieve the next set of results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupings:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_groupings</a> - The grouping applied to the
--   metrics returned. For example, when grouped by <tt>QUEUE</tt>, the
--   metrics returned apply to each queue rather than aggregated for all
--   queues. If you group by <tt>CHANNEL</tt>, you should include a
--   Channels filter. VOICE, CHAT, and TASK channels are supported.
--   
--   If no <tt>Grouping</tt> is included in the request, a summary of
--   metrics is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to return per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_filters</a> - The queues, up to 100, or
--   channels, to use to filter the metrics returned. Metric data is
--   retrieved only for the resources associated with the queues or
--   channels included in the filter. You can include both queue IDs and
--   queue ARNs in the same request. VOICE, CHAT, and TASK channels are
--   supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentMetrics:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_currentMetrics</a> - The metrics to retrieve.
--   Specify the name and unit for each metric. The following metrics are
--   available. For a description of all the metrics, see <a>Real-time
--   Metrics Definitions</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_AFTER_CONTACT_WORK</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time
--   metrics report: <a>ACW</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_AVAILABLE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Available</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ERROR</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Error</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_NON_PRODUCTIVE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>NPT (Non-Productive Time)</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ON_CALL</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>On contact</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ON_CONTACT</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>On contact</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ONLINE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Online</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_STAFFED</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Staffed</a></li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_IN_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>In queue</a></li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_SCHEDULED</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Scheduled</a></li>
--   <li><i>OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE</i> Unit: SECONDSWhen you use groupings,
--   Unit says SECONDS and the Value is returned in SECONDS.When you do not
--   use groupings, Unit says SECONDS but the Value is returned in
--   MILLISECONDS. For example, if you get a response like this:<tt>{
--   "Metric": { "Name": "OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE", "Unit": "SECONDS" },
--   "Value": 24113.0 </tt>}The actual OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE is 24
--   seconds.Name in real-time metrics report: <a>Oldest</a></li>
--   <li><i>SLOTS_ACTIVE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Active</a></li>
--   <li><i>SLOTS_AVAILABLE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Availability</a></li>
--   </ul>
newGetCurrentMetricData :: Text -> Filters -> GetCurrentMetricData

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
getCurrentMetricData_nextToken :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricData (Maybe Text)

-- | The grouping applied to the metrics returned. For example, when
--   grouped by <tt>QUEUE</tt>, the metrics returned apply to each queue
--   rather than aggregated for all queues. If you group by
--   <tt>CHANNEL</tt>, you should include a Channels filter. VOICE, CHAT,
--   and TASK channels are supported.
--   
--   If no <tt>Grouping</tt> is included in the request, a summary of
--   metrics is returned.
getCurrentMetricData_groupings :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricData (Maybe [Grouping])

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
getCurrentMetricData_maxResults :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricData (Maybe Natural)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
getCurrentMetricData_instanceId :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricData Text

-- | The queues, up to 100, or channels, to use to filter the metrics
--   returned. Metric data is retrieved only for the resources associated
--   with the queues or channels included in the filter. You can include
--   both queue IDs and queue ARNs in the same request. VOICE, CHAT, and
--   TASK channels are supported.
getCurrentMetricData_filters :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricData Filters

-- | The metrics to retrieve. Specify the name and unit for each metric.
--   The following metrics are available. For a description of all the
--   metrics, see <a>Real-time Metrics Definitions</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_AFTER_CONTACT_WORK</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time
--   metrics report: <a>ACW</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_AVAILABLE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Available</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ERROR</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Error</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_NON_PRODUCTIVE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>NPT (Non-Productive Time)</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ON_CALL</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>On contact</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ON_CONTACT</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>On contact</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ONLINE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Online</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_STAFFED</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Staffed</a></li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_IN_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>In queue</a></li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_SCHEDULED</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Scheduled</a></li>
--   <li><i>OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE</i> Unit: SECONDSWhen you use groupings,
--   Unit says SECONDS and the Value is returned in SECONDS.When you do not
--   use groupings, Unit says SECONDS but the Value is returned in
--   MILLISECONDS. For example, if you get a response like this:<tt>{
--   "Metric": { "Name": "OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE", "Unit": "SECONDS" },
--   "Value": 24113.0 </tt>}The actual OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE is 24
--   seconds.Name in real-time metrics report: <a>Oldest</a></li>
--   <li><i>SLOTS_ACTIVE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Active</a></li>
--   <li><i>SLOTS_AVAILABLE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Availability</a></li>
--   </ul>
getCurrentMetricData_currentMetrics :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricData [CurrentMetric]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetCurrentMetricDataResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetCurrentMetricDataResponse
GetCurrentMetricDataResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [CurrentMetricResult] -> Int -> GetCurrentMetricDataResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
[$sel:nextToken:GetCurrentMetricDataResponse'] :: GetCurrentMetricDataResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The time at which the metrics were retrieved and cached for
--   pagination.
[$sel:dataSnapshotTime:GetCurrentMetricDataResponse'] :: GetCurrentMetricDataResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Information about the real-time metrics.
[$sel:metricResults:GetCurrentMetricDataResponse'] :: GetCurrentMetricDataResponse -> Maybe [CurrentMetricResult]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetCurrentMetricDataResponse'] :: GetCurrentMetricDataResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetCurrentMetricDataResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricDataResponse_nextToken</a> - If there are
--   additional results, this is the token for the next set of results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataSnapshotTime:GetCurrentMetricDataResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricDataResponse_dataSnapshotTime</a> - The time at
--   which the metrics were retrieved and cached for pagination.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricResults:GetCurrentMetricDataResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricDataResponse_metricResults</a> - Information about
--   the real-time metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetCurrentMetricDataResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricDataResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetCurrentMetricDataResponse :: Int -> GetCurrentMetricDataResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
getCurrentMetricDataResponse_nextToken :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricDataResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The time at which the metrics were retrieved and cached for
--   pagination.

-- | Information about the real-time metrics.

-- | Describes the specified user account. You can find the instance ID in
--   the console (its the final part of the ARN). The console does not
--   display the user IDs. Instead, list the users and note the IDs
--   provided in the output.
module Network.AWS.Connect.DescribeUser

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeUser</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeUser
DescribeUser' :: Text -> Text -> DescribeUser

-- | The identifier of the user account.
[$sel:userId:DescribeUser'] :: DescribeUser -> Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:DescribeUser'] :: DescribeUser -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeUser</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userId:DescribeUser'</a>, <a>describeUser_userId</a> - The
--   identifier of the user account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:DescribeUser'</a>, <a>describeUser_instanceId</a> -
--   The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
newDescribeUser :: Text -> Text -> DescribeUser

-- | The identifier of the user account.
describeUser_userId :: Lens' DescribeUser Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
describeUser_instanceId :: Lens' DescribeUser Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeUserResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeUserResponse
DescribeUserResponse' :: Maybe User -> Int -> DescribeUserResponse

-- | Information about the user account and configuration settings.
[$sel:user:DescribeUserResponse'] :: DescribeUserResponse -> Maybe User

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeUserResponse'] :: DescribeUserResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeUserResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

-- | This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and is subject to
--   change.
--   
--   Returns the current state of the specified instance identifier. It
--   tracks the instance while it is being created and returns an error
--   status, if applicable.
--   
--   If an instance is not created successfully, the instance status reason
--   field returns details relevant to the reason. The instance in a failed
--   state is returned only for 24 hours after the CreateInstance API was
--   invoked.
module Network.AWS.Connect.DescribeInstance

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeInstance</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeInstance
DescribeInstance' :: Text -> DescribeInstance

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:DescribeInstance'] :: DescribeInstance -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeInstance</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:DescribeInstance'</a>,
--   <a>describeInstance_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
newDescribeInstance :: Text -> DescribeInstance

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
describeInstance_instanceId :: Lens' DescribeInstance Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeInstanceResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeInstanceResponse
DescribeInstanceResponse' :: Maybe Instance -> Int -> DescribeInstanceResponse

-- | The name of the instance.
[$sel:instance':DescribeInstanceResponse'] :: DescribeInstanceResponse -> Maybe Instance

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeInstanceResponse'] :: DescribeInstanceResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeInstanceResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instance':DescribeInstanceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeInstanceResponse_instance</a> - The name of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeInstanceResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeInstanceResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeInstanceResponse :: Int -> DescribeInstanceResponse

-- | This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and is subject to
--   change.
--   
--   Deletes the Amazon Connect instance.
--   
--   Amazon Connect enforces a limit on the total number of instances that
--   you can create or delete in 30 days. If you exceed this limit, you
--   will get an error message indicating there has been an excessive
--   number of attempts at creating or deleting instances. You must wait 30
--   days before you can restart creating and deleting instances in your
--   account.

--   created at level one if the parent group ID is null.

--   characters.
[$sel:name:CreateUserHierarchyGroup'] :: CreateUserHierarchyGroup -> Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.

-- | Creates a user account for the specified Amazon Connect instance.
--   
--   For information about how to create user accounts using the Amazon
--   Connect console, see <a>Add Users</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect
--   Administrator Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Connect.CreateUser

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateUser</a> smart constructor.
data CreateUser
CreateUser' :: Maybe UserIdentityInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> UserPhoneConfig -> NonEmpty Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateUser

-- | The information about the identity of the user.
[$sel:identityInfo:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> Maybe UserIdentityInfo

-- | The identifier of the hierarchy group for the user.
[$sel:hierarchyGroupId:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the user account in the directory used for identity
--   management. If Amazon Connect cannot access the directory, you can
--   specify this identifier to authenticate users. If you include the
--   identifier, we assume that Amazon Connect cannot access the directory.
--   Otherwise, the identity information is used to authenticate users from
--   your directory.
--   
--   This parameter is required if you are using an existing directory for
--   identity management in Amazon Connect when Amazon Connect cannot
--   access your directory to authenticate users. If you are using SAML for
--   identity management and include this parameter, an error is returned.
[$sel:directoryUserId:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> Maybe Text

-- | The password for the user account. A password is required if you are
--   using Amazon Connect for identity management. Otherwise, it is an
--   error to include a password.
[$sel:password:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The user name for the account. For instances not using SAML for
--   identity management, the user name can include up to 20 characters. If
--   you are using SAML for identity management, the user name can include
--   up to 64 characters from [a-zA-Z0-9_-.\@]+.
[$sel:username:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> Text

-- | The phone settings for the user.
[$sel:phoneConfig:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> UserPhoneConfig

-- | The identifier of the security profile for the user.
[$sel:securityProfileIds:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> NonEmpty Text

-- | The identifier of the routing profile for the user.
[$sel:routingProfileId:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:CreateUser'] :: CreateUser -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateUser</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityInfo:CreateUser'</a>, <a>createUser_identityInfo</a> -

--   group for the user.
--

--   <a>createUser_directoryUserId</a> - The identifier of the user account
--   in the directory used for identity management. If Amazon Connect
--   cannot access the directory, you can specify this identifier to
--   authenticate users. If you include the identifier, we assume that
--   Amazon Connect cannot access the directory. Otherwise, the identity
--   information is used to authenticate users from your directory.
--   
--   This parameter is required if you are using an existing directory for
--   identity management in Amazon Connect when Amazon Connect cannot
--   access your directory to authenticate users. If you are using SAML for
--   identity management and include this parameter, an error is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:CreateUser'</a>, <a>createUser_password</a> - The
--   password for the user account. A password is required if you are using
--   Amazon Connect for identity management. Otherwise, it is an error to
--   include a password.

--   
--   <a>$sel:username:CreateUser'</a>, <a>createUser_username</a> - The

-- | The identifier of the hierarchy group for the user.

-- | Creates a use case for an integration association.
module Network.AWS.Connect.CreateUseCase

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateUseCase</a> smart constructor.
data CreateUseCase
CreateUseCase' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> UseCaseType -> CreateUseCase

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:CreateUseCase'] :: CreateUseCase -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.

-- | The identifier for the integration association.
[$sel:integrationAssociationId:CreateUseCase'] :: CreateUseCase -> Text

-- | The type of use case to associate to the integration association. Each
--   integration association can have only one of each use case type.
[$sel:useCaseType:CreateUseCase'] :: CreateUseCase -> UseCaseType

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateUseCase</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:CreateUseCase'</a>, <a>createUseCase_instanceId</a>
--   - The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:integrationAssociationId:CreateUseCase'</a>,
--   <a>createUseCase_integrationAssociationId</a> - The identifier for the
--   integration association.
--   
--   <a>$sel:useCaseType:CreateUseCase'</a>,

--   to the integration association. Each integration association can have
--   only one of each use case type.

createUseCase_tags :: Lens' CreateUseCase (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

createUseCase_integrationAssociationId :: Lens' CreateUseCase Text

--   integration association can have only one of each use case type.
createUseCase_useCaseType :: Lens' CreateUseCase UseCaseType

-- | Creates a new routing profile.
module Network.AWS.Connect.CreateRoutingProfile

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateRoutingProfile</a> smart constructor.
data CreateRoutingProfile
CreateRoutingProfile' :: Maybe (NonEmpty RoutingProfileQueueConfig) -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> [MediaConcurrency] -> CreateRoutingProfile

-- | The inbound queues associated with the routing profile. If no queue is
--   added, the agent can make only outbound calls.
[$sel:queueConfigs:CreateRoutingProfile'] :: CreateRoutingProfile -> Maybe (NonEmpty RoutingProfileQueueConfig)

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:CreateRoutingProfile'] :: CreateRoutingProfile -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:CreateRoutingProfile'] :: CreateRoutingProfile -> Text

-- | The name of the routing profile. Must not be more than 127 characters.
[$sel:name:CreateRoutingProfile'] :: CreateRoutingProfile -> Text

-- | Description of the routing profile. Must not be more than 250
--   characters.
[$sel:description:CreateRoutingProfile'] :: CreateRoutingProfile -> Text

-- | The default outbound queue for the routing profile.
[$sel:defaultOutboundQueueId:CreateRoutingProfile'] :: CreateRoutingProfile -> Text

-- | The channels that agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel (CCP)
--   for this routing profile.
[$sel:mediaConcurrencies:CreateRoutingProfile'] :: CreateRoutingProfile -> [MediaConcurrency]

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateRoutingProfile</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueConfigs:CreateRoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createRoutingProfile_queueConfigs</a> - The inbound queues
--   associated with the routing profile. If no queue is added, the agent
--   can make only outbound calls.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateRoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createRoutingProfile_tags</a> - One or more tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:CreateRoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createRoutingProfile_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateRoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createRoutingProfile_name</a> - The name of the routing profile.
--   Must not be more than 127 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateRoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createRoutingProfile_description</a> - Description of the routing
--   profile. Must not be more than 250 characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultOutboundQueueId:CreateRoutingProfile'</a>,
--   <a>createRoutingProfile_defaultOutboundQueueId</a> - The default
--   outbound queue for the routing profile.
--

--   <a>createRoutingProfile_mediaConcurrencies</a> - The channels that
--   agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel (CCP) for this routing
--   profile.
newCreateRoutingProfile :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateRoutingProfile

-- | One or more tags.
createRoutingProfile_tags :: Lens' CreateRoutingProfile (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and is subject to
--   change.
--   
--   Creates a new queue for the specified Amazon Connect instance.
module Network.AWS.Connect.CreateQueue

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateQueue</a> smart constructor.
data CreateQueue
CreateQueue' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe OutboundCallerConfig -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateQueue

-- | The maximum number of contacts that can be in the queue before it is
--   considered full.
[$sel:maxContacts:CreateQueue'] :: CreateQueue -> Maybe Natural

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:CreateQueue'] :: CreateQueue -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The description of the queue.
[$sel:description:CreateQueue'] :: CreateQueue -> Maybe Text

-- | The outbound caller ID name, number, and outbound whisper flow.
[$sel:outboundCallerConfig:CreateQueue'] :: CreateQueue -> Maybe OutboundCallerConfig

-- | The quick connects available to agents who are working the queue.
[$sel:quickConnectIds:CreateQueue'] :: CreateQueue -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:CreateQueue'] :: CreateQueue -> Text

-- | The name of the queue.
[$sel:name:CreateQueue'] :: CreateQueue -> Text

-- | The identifier for the hours of operation.
[$sel:hoursOfOperationId:CreateQueue'] :: CreateQueue -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateQueue</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   The maximum number of contacts that can be in the queue before it is
--   considered full.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateQueue'</a>, <a>createQueue_tags</a> - One or more
--   tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateQueue'</a>, <a>createQueue_description</a> -
--   The description of the queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:outboundCallerConfig:CreateQueue'</a>,
--   <a>createQueue_outboundCallerConfig</a> - The outbound caller ID name,
--   number, and outbound whisper flow.
--

--   <a>createQueue_quickConnectIds</a> - The quick connects available to
--   agents who are working the queue.
--

--   The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.

--   the queue.

--   <a>createQueue_hoursOfOperationId</a> - The identifier for the hours
--   of operation.
newCreateQueue :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateQueue

--   considered full.
createQueue_maxContacts :: Lens' CreateQueue (Maybe Natural)

-- | One or more tags.
createQueue_tags :: Lens' CreateQueue (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The description of the queue.

-- | Creates an AWS resource association with an Amazon Connect instance.
module Network.AWS.Connect.CreateIntegrationAssociation

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateIntegrationAssociation</a> smart constructor.
data CreateIntegrationAssociation
CreateIntegrationAssociation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe SourceType -> Text -> IntegrationType -> Text -> CreateIntegrationAssociation

-- | The name of the external application. This field is only required for
--   the EVENT integration type.
[$sel:sourceApplicationName:CreateIntegrationAssociation'] :: CreateIntegrationAssociation -> Maybe Text

-- | The URL for the external application. This field is only required for
--   the EVENT integration type.
[$sel:sourceApplicationUrl:CreateIntegrationAssociation'] :: CreateIntegrationAssociation -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more tags.
[$sel:tags:CreateIntegrationAssociation'] :: CreateIntegrationAssociation -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The type of the data source. This field is only required for the EVENT
--   integration type.
[$sel:sourceType:CreateIntegrationAssociation'] :: CreateIntegrationAssociation -> Maybe SourceType

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:CreateIntegrationAssociation'] :: CreateIntegrationAssociation -> Text

-- | The type of information to be ingested.
[$sel:integrationType:CreateIntegrationAssociation'] :: CreateIntegrationAssociation -> IntegrationType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the integration.
[$sel:integrationArn:CreateIntegrationAssociation'] :: CreateIntegrationAssociation -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateIntegrationAssociation</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

-- | This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and is subject to
--   change.
--   
--   Initiates an Amazon Connect instance with all the supported channels
--   enabled. It does not attach any storage, such as Amazon Simple Storage
--   Service (Amazon S3) or Amazon Kinesis. It also does not allow for any
--   configurations on features, such as Contact Lens for Amazon Connect.
--   
--   Amazon Connect enforces a limit on the total number of instances that
--   you can create or delete in 30 days. If you exceed this limit, you
--   will get an error message indicating there has been an excessive
--   number of attempts at creating or deleting instances. You must wait 30
--   days before you can restart creating and deleting instances in your
--   account.
module Network.AWS.Connect.CreateInstance

--   status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateAgentStatus'</a>, <a>createAgentStatus_tags</a> -
--   One or more tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateAgentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAgentStatus_description</a> - The description of the status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:CreateAgentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>createAgentStatus_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateAgentStatus'</a>, <a>createAgentStatus_name</a> -
--   The name of the status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:CreateAgentStatus'</a>, <a>createAgentStatus_state</a> -
--   The state of the status.
newCreateAgentStatus :: Text -> Text -> AgentStatusState -> CreateAgentStatus

-- | The display order of the status.
createAgentStatus_displayOrder :: Lens' CreateAgentStatus (Maybe Natural)

-- | One or more tags.
createAgentStatus_tags :: Lens' CreateAgentStatus (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The description of the status.
createAgentStatus_description :: Lens' CreateAgentStatus (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
createAgentStatus_instanceId :: Lens' CreateAgentStatus Text

-- | The name of the status.
createAgentStatus_name :: Lens' CreateAgentStatus Text

-- | The state of the status.
createAgentStatus_state :: Lens' CreateAgentStatus AgentStatusState

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAgentStatusResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateAgentStatusResponse
CreateAgentStatusResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Int -> CreateAgentStatusResponse

-- | The identifier of the agent status.
[$sel:agentStatusId:CreateAgentStatusResponse'] :: CreateAgentStatusResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the agent status.
[$sel:agentStatusARN:CreateAgentStatusResponse'] :: CreateAgentStatusResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateAgentStatusResponse'] :: CreateAgentStatusResponse -> Int

--   fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentStatusARN:CreateAgentStatusResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createAgentStatusResponse_agentStatusARN</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateAgentStatusResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createAgentStatusResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.

-- | This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and is subject to
--   change.
--   
--   Associates a storage resource type for the first time. You can only
--   associate one type of storage configuration in a single call. This
--   means, for example, that you can't define an instance with multiple S3
--   buckets for storing chat transcripts.
--   
--   This API does not create a resource that doesn't exist. It only
--   associates it to the instance. Ensure that the resource being
--   specified in the storage configuration, like an S3 bucket, exists when
--   being used for association.
module Network.AWS.Connect.AssociateInstanceStorageConfig

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAssociateInstanceStorageConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AssociateInstanceStorageConfig
AssociateInstanceStorageConfig' :: Text -> InstanceStorageResourceType -> InstanceStorageConfig -> AssociateInstanceStorageConfig

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:AssociateInstanceStorageConfig'] :: AssociateInstanceStorageConfig -> Text

-- | A valid resource type.
[$sel:resourceType:AssociateInstanceStorageConfig'] :: AssociateInstanceStorageConfig -> InstanceStorageResourceType

-- | A valid storage type.
[$sel:storageConfig:AssociateInstanceStorageConfig'] :: AssociateInstanceStorageConfig -> InstanceStorageConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>AssociateInstanceStorageConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:AssociateInstanceStorageConfig'</a>,
--   <a>associateInstanceStorageConfig_instanceId</a> - The identifier of
--   the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of

-- | Creates or updates user-defined contact attributes associated with the
--   specified contact.
--   
--   You can create or update user-defined attributes for both ongoing and
--   completed contacts. For example, while the call is active, you can
--   update the customer's name or the reason the customer called. You can
--   add notes about steps that the agent took during the call that display
--   to the next agent that takes the call. You can also update attributes
--   for a contact using data from your CRM application and save the data
--   with the contact in Amazon Connect. You could also flag calls for
--   additional analysis, such as legal review or to identify abusive
--   callers.
--   
--   Contact attributes are available in Amazon Connect for 24 months, and
--   are then deleted. For information about CTR retention and the maximum
--   size of the CTR attributes section, see <a>Feature specifications</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   <b>Important:</b> You cannot use the operation to update attributes
--   for contacts that occurred prior to the release of the API, which was
--   September 12, 2018. You can update attributes only for contacts that
--   started after the release of the API. If you attempt to update
--   attributes for a contact that occurred prior to the release of the
--   API, a 400 error is returned. This applies also to queued callbacks
--   that were initiated prior to the release of the API but are still
--   active in your instance.
module Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateContactAttributes

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContactAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateContactAttributes
UpdateContactAttributes' :: Text -> Text -> HashMap Text Text -> UpdateContactAttributes

-- | The identifier of the contact. This is the identifier of the contact
--   associated with the first interaction with the contact center.
[$sel:initialContactId:UpdateContactAttributes'] :: UpdateContactAttributes -> Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:UpdateContactAttributes'] :: UpdateContactAttributes -> Text

-- | The Amazon Connect attributes. These attributes can be accessed in
--   contact flows just like any other contact attributes.
--   
--   You can have up to 32,768 UTF-8 bytes across all attributes for a
--   contact. Attribute keys can include only alphanumeric, dash, and
--   underscore characters.
[$sel:attributes:UpdateContactAttributes'] :: UpdateContactAttributes -> HashMap Text Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateContactAttributes</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:initialContactId:UpdateContactAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>updateContactAttributes_initialContactId</a> - The identifier of
--   the contact. This is the identifier of the contact associated with the
--   first interaction with the contact center.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:UpdateContactAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>updateContactAttributes_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the
--   Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:UpdateContactAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>updateContactAttributes_attributes</a> - The Amazon Connect
--   attributes. These attributes can be accessed in contact flows just
--   like any other contact attributes.
--   
--   You can have up to 32,768 UTF-8 bytes across all attributes for a
--   contact. Attribute keys can include only alphanumeric, dash, and
--   underscore characters.
newUpdateContactAttributes :: Text -> Text -> UpdateContactAttributes

-- | The identifier of the contact. This is the identifier of the contact
--   associated with the first interaction with the contact center.
updateContactAttributes_initialContactId :: Lens' UpdateContactAttributes Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
updateContactAttributes_instanceId :: Lens' UpdateContactAttributes Text

-- | The Amazon Connect attributes. These attributes can be accessed in
--   contact flows just like any other contact attributes.
--   
--   You can have up to 32,768 UTF-8 bytes across all attributes for a
--   contact. Attribute keys can include only alphanumeric, dash, and
--   underscore characters.
updateContactAttributes_attributes :: Lens' UpdateContactAttributes (HashMap Text Text)

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContactAttributesResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateContactAttributesResponse
UpdateContactAttributesResponse' :: Int -> UpdateContactAttributesResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateContactAttributesResponse'] :: UpdateContactAttributesResponse -> Int

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

-- | Updates the specified contact flow.
--   
--   You can also create and update contact flows using the <a>Amazon
--   Connect Flow language</a>.

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContactFlowContent</a> smart constructor.

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateContactFlowContent</a> with all optional

-- | This API is in preview release for Amazon Connect and is subject to
--   change.

--   Updates the maximum number of contacts allowed in a queue before it is
--   considered full.
module Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateQueueMaxContacts

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateQueueMaxContacts</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateQueueMaxContacts
UpdateQueueMaxContacts' :: Maybe Natural -> Text -> Text -> UpdateQueueMaxContacts

-- | The maximum number of contacts that can be in the queue before it is
--   considered full.
[$sel:maxContacts:UpdateQueueMaxContacts'] :: UpdateQueueMaxContacts -> Maybe Natural

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:UpdateQueueMaxContacts'] :: UpdateQueueMaxContacts -> Text

-- | The identifier for the queue.
[$sel:queueId:UpdateQueueMaxContacts'] :: UpdateQueueMaxContacts -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateQueueMaxContacts</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxContacts:UpdateQueueMaxContacts'</a>,
--   <a>updateQueueMaxContacts_maxContacts</a> - The maximum number of
--   contacts that can be in the queue before it is considered full.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:UpdateQueueMaxContacts'</a>,
--   <a>updateQueueMaxContacts_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the
--   Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueId:UpdateQueueMaxContacts'</a>,
--   <a>updateQueueMaxContacts_queueId</a> - The identifier for the queue.
newUpdateQueueMaxContacts :: Text -> Text -> UpdateQueueMaxContacts

--   considered full.

--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.

-- | The identifier for the queue.
updateQueueMaxContacts_queueId :: Lens' UpdateQueueMaxContacts Text

-- | Updates the name and description of a routing profile. The request
--   accepts the following data in JSON format. At least <tt>Name</tt> or
--   <tt>Description</tt> must be provided.
module Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateRoutingProfileName

data UpdateRoutingProfileName
UpdateRoutingProfileName' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateRoutingProfileName

-- | The name of the routing profile. Must not be more than 127 characters.
[$sel:name:UpdateRoutingProfileName'] :: UpdateRoutingProfileName -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the routing profile. Must not be more than 250
--   characters.

--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.

-- | Updates the identity information for the specified user.
--   
--   We strongly recommend limiting who has the ability to invoke
--   <tt>UpdateUserIdentityInfo</tt>. Someone with that ability can change
--   the login credentials of other users by changing their email address.
--   This poses a security risk to your organization. They can change the
--   email address of a user to the attacker's email address, and then
--   reset the password through email. For more information, see <a>Best
--   Practices for Security Profiles</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect
--   Administrator Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateUserIdentityInfo

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateUserIdentityInfo</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateUserIdentityInfo
UpdateUserIdentityInfo' :: UserIdentityInfo -> Text -> Text -> UpdateUserIdentityInfo

-- | The identity information for the user.
[$sel:identityInfo:UpdateUserIdentityInfo'] :: UpdateUserIdentityInfo -> UserIdentityInfo

-- | The identifier of the user account.
[$sel:userId:UpdateUserIdentityInfo'] :: UpdateUserIdentityInfo -> Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
[$sel:instanceId:UpdateUserIdentityInfo'] :: UpdateUserIdentityInfo -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateUserIdentityInfo</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityInfo:UpdateUserIdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>updateUserIdentityInfo_identityInfo</a> - The identity information
--   for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userId:UpdateUserIdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>updateUserIdentityInfo_userId</a> - The identifier of the user
--   account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:UpdateUserIdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>updateUserIdentityInfo_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the
--   Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
newUpdateUserIdentityInfo :: UserIdentityInfo -> Text -> Text -> UpdateUserIdentityInfo

-- | The identity information for the user.
updateUserIdentityInfo_identityInfo :: Lens' UpdateUserIdentityInfo UserIdentityInfo

-- | The identifier of the user account.
updateUserIdentityInfo_userId :: Lens' UpdateUserIdentityInfo Text

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
updateUserIdentityInfo_instanceId :: Lens' UpdateUserIdentityInfo Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateUserIdentityInfoResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateUserIdentityInfoResponse
UpdateUserIdentityInfoResponse' :: UpdateUserIdentityInfoResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateUserIdentityInfoResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newUpdateUserIdentityInfoResponse :: UpdateUserIdentityInfoResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateUserIdentityInfo.UpdateUserIdentityInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateUserIdentityInfo.UpdateUserIdentityInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateUserIdentityInfo.UpdateUserIdentityInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateUserIdentityInfo.UpdateUserIdentityInfo
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateUserIdentityInfo.UpdateUserIdentityInfoResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateUserIdentityInfo.UpdateUserIdentityInfoResponse

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateUserIdentityInfo.UpdateUserIdentityInfoResponse

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateUserIdentityInfo.UpdateUserIdentityInfoResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Connect.UpdateUserIdentityInfo.UpdateUserIdentityInfo

-- | The grouping applied to the metrics returned. For example, when
--   grouped by <tt>QUEUE</tt>, the metrics returned apply to each queue
--   rather than aggregated for all queues. If you group by
--   <tt>CHANNEL</tt>, you should include a Channels filter. VOICE, CHAT,
--   and TASK channels are supported.
--   
--   If no <tt>Grouping</tt> is included in the request, a summary of
--   metrics is returned.
getCurrentMetricData_groupings :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricData (Maybe [Grouping])

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
getCurrentMetricData_maxResults :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricData (Maybe Natural)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
getCurrentMetricData_instanceId :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricData Text

-- | The queues, up to 100, or channels, to use to filter the metrics
--   returned. Metric data is retrieved only for the resources associated
--   with the queues or channels included in the filter. You can include
--   both queue IDs and queue ARNs in the same request. VOICE, CHAT, and
--   TASK channels are supported.
getCurrentMetricData_filters :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricData Filters

-- | The metrics to retrieve. Specify the name and unit for each metric.
--   The following metrics are available. For a description of all the
--   metrics, see <a>Real-time Metrics Definitions</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_AFTER_CONTACT_WORK</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time
--   metrics report: <a>ACW</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_AVAILABLE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Available</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ERROR</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Error</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_NON_PRODUCTIVE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>NPT (Non-Productive Time)</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ON_CALL</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>On contact</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ON_CONTACT</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>On contact</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ONLINE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Online</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_STAFFED</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Staffed</a></li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_IN_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>In queue</a></li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_SCHEDULED</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Scheduled</a></li>
--   <li><i>OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE</i> Unit: SECONDSWhen you use groupings,
--   Unit says SECONDS and the Value is returned in SECONDS.When you do not
--   use groupings, Unit says SECONDS but the Value is returned in
--   MILLISECONDS. For example, if you get a response like this:<tt>{
--   "Metric": { "Name": "OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE", "Unit": "SECONDS" },
--   "Value": 24113.0 </tt>}The actual OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE is 24
--   seconds.Name in real-time metrics report: <a>Oldest</a></li>
--   <li><i>SLOTS_ACTIVE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Active</a></li>
--   <li><i>SLOTS_AVAILABLE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Availability</a></li>
--   </ul>
getCurrentMetricData_currentMetrics :: Lens' GetCurrentMetricData [CurrentMetric]

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
--

--   parameters as the request that generated the token.

-- | The type of quick connect. In the Amazon Connect console, when you
--   create a quick connect, you are prompted to assign one of the
--   following types: Agent (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue
--   (QUEUE).

--   There can be up to 32,768 UTF-8 bytes across all key-value pairs per

--   underscore characters.

--   navigation menu go to <b>Routing</b>, <b>Contact Flows</b>. Choose the
--   contact flow. On the contact flow page, under the name of the contact
--   flow, choose <b>Show additional flow information</b>. The
--   ContactFlowId is the last part of the ARN, shown here in bold:

-- | A custom key-value pair using an attribute map. The attributes are

--   contact flow. On the contact flow page, under the name of the contact
--   flow, choose <b>Show additional flow information</b>. The
--   ContactFlowId is the last part of the ARN, shown here in bold:
--   
--

--   not specify a queue, the queue defined in the contact flow is used. If
--   you do not specify a queue, you must specify a source phone number.

-- | Denotes the class of traffic. Calls with different traffic types are
--   handled differently by Amazon Connect. The default value is
--   <tt>GENERAL</tt>. Use <tt>CAMPAIGN</tt> if
--   <tt>EnableAnswerMachineDetection</tt> is set to <tt>true</tt>. For all
--   other cases, use <tt>GENERAL</tt>.
