-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
getMetricData_nextToken :: Lens' GetMetricData (Maybe Text)

-- | The grouping applied to the metrics returned. For example, when
--   results are grouped by queue, the metrics returned are grouped by
--   queue. The values returned apply to the metrics for each queue rather
--   than aggregated for all queues.
--   
--   If no grouping is specified, a summary of metrics for all queues is
--   returned.
getMetricData_groupings :: Lens' GetMetricData (Maybe [Grouping])

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
getMetricData_maxResults :: Lens' GetMetricData (Maybe Natural)

-- | The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
getMetricData_instanceId :: Lens' GetMetricData Text

-- | The timestamp, in UNIX Epoch time format, at which to start the
--   reporting interval for the retrieval of historical metrics data. The
--   time must be specified using a multiple of 5 minutes, such as 10:05,
--   10:10, 10:15.
--   
--   The start time cannot be earlier than 24 hours before the time of the
--   request. Historical metrics are available only for 24 hours.
getMetricData_startTime :: Lens' GetMetricData UTCTime

-- | The timestamp, in UNIX Epoch time format, at which to end the
--   reporting interval for the retrieval of historical metrics data. The
--   time must be specified using an interval of 5 minutes, such as 11:00,
--   11:05, 11:10, and must be later than the start time timestamp.
--   
--   The time range between the start and end time must be less than 24
--   hours.
getMetricData_endTime :: Lens' GetMetricData UTCTime

-- | The queues, up to 100, or channels, to use to filter the metrics
--   returned. Metric data is retrieved only for the resources associated
--   with the queues or channels included in the filter. You can include
--   both queue IDs and queue ARNs in the same request. VOICE, CHAT, and
--   TASK channels are supported.
--   
--   To filter by <tt>Queues</tt>, enter the queue ID/ARN, not the name of
--   the queue.
getMetricData_filters :: Lens' GetMetricData Filters

-- | The metrics to retrieve. Specify the name, unit, and statistic for
--   each metric. The following historical metrics are available. For a
--   description of each metric, see <a>Historical Metrics Definitions</a>
--   in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   This API does not support a contacts incoming metric (there's no
--   CONTACTS_INCOMING metric missing from the documented list).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>ABANDON_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>AFTER_CONTACT_WORK_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>API_CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CALLBACK_CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_ABANDONED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_AGENT_HUNG_UP_FIRST</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_CONSULTED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED_INCOMING</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED_OUTBOUND</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HOLD_ABANDONS</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_MISSED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_QUEUED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_IN</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_IN_FROM_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic:
--   SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_OUT</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_OUT_FROM_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic:
--   SUM</li>
--   <li><i>HANDLE_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>HOLD_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>INTERACTION_AND_HOLD_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>INTERACTION_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>OCCUPANCY</i> Unit: PERCENTStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>QUEUE_ANSWER_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>QUEUED_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: MAX</li>
--   <li><i>SERVICE_LEVEL</i> You can include up to 20 SERVICE_LEVEL
--   metrics in a request.Unit: PERCENTStatistic: AVGThreshold: For
--   <tt>ThresholdValue</tt>, enter any whole number from 1 to 604800
--   (inclusive), in seconds. For <tt>Comparison</tt>, you must enter
--   <tt>LT</tt> (for "Less than").</li>
--   </ul>
getMetricData_historicalMetrics :: Lens' GetMetricData [HistoricalMetric]

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
getMetricDataResponse_nextToken :: Lens' GetMetricDataResponse (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Connect.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2017-08-08</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon Connect is a cloud-based contact center solution that you use
--   to set up and manage a customer contact center and provide reliable
--   customer engagement at any scale.
--   
--   Amazon Connect provides metrics and real-time reporting that enable
--   you to optimize contact routing. You can also resolve customer issues
--   more efficiently by getting customers in touch with the appropriate
--   agents.
--   
--   There are limits to the number of Amazon Connect resources that you
--   can create. There are also limits to the number of requests that you
--   can make per second. For more information, see <a>Amazon Connect
--   Service Quotas</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   You can connect programmatically to an AWS service by using an
--   endpoint. For a list of Amazon Connect endpoints, see <a>Amazon
--   Connect Endpoints</a>.
--   
--   Working with contact flows? Check out the <a>Amazon Connect Flow
--   language</a>.
module Network.AWS.Connect

-- | API version <tt>2017-08-08</tt> of the Amazon Connect Service SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The service quota has been exceeded.
_ServiceQuotaExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The contact is not permitted.
_OutboundContactNotPermittedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource already has that name.
_ResourceConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The contact flow has not been published.
_ContactFlowNotPublishedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | No user with the specified credentials was found in the Amazon Connect
--   instance.
_UserNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Request processing failed because of an error or failure with the
--   service.
_InternalServiceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A resource with the specified name already exists.
_DuplicateResourceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The throttling limit has been exceeded.
_ThrottlingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | One or more of the specified parameters are not valid.
_InvalidParameterException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request is not valid.
_InvalidRequestException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The contact flow is not valid.
_InvalidContactFlowException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The contact with the specified ID is not active or does not exist.
_ContactNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The allowed limit for the resource has been exceeded.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | That resource is already in use. Please try another.
_ResourceInUseException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource was not found.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Outbound calls to the destination number are not allowed.
_DestinationNotAllowedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Create a value of <a>GetCurrentMetricData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_nextToken</a> - The token for the next set of
--   results. Use the value returned in the previous response in the next
--   request to retrieve the next set of results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupings:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_groupings</a> - The grouping applied to the
--   metrics returned. For example, when grouped by <tt>QUEUE</tt>, the
--   metrics returned apply to each queue rather than aggregated for all
--   queues. If you group by <tt>CHANNEL</tt>, you should include a
--   Channels filter. VOICE, CHAT, and TASK channels are supported.
--   
--   If no <tt>Grouping</tt> is included in the request, a summary of
--   metrics is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to return per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the Amazon
--   Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_filters</a> - The queues, up to 100, or
--   channels, to use to filter the metrics returned. Metric data is
--   retrieved only for the resources associated with the queues or
--   channels included in the filter. You can include both queue IDs and
--   queue ARNs in the same request. VOICE, CHAT, and TASK channels are
--   supported.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentMetrics:GetCurrentMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getCurrentMetricData_currentMetrics</a> - The metrics to retrieve.
--   Specify the name and unit for each metric. The following metrics are
--   available. For a description of all the metrics, see <a>Real-time
--   Metrics Definitions</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect Administrator
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_AFTER_CONTACT_WORK</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time
--   metrics report: <a>ACW</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_AVAILABLE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Available</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ERROR</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Error</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_NON_PRODUCTIVE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>NPT (Non-Productive Time)</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ON_CALL</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>On contact</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ON_CONTACT</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>On contact</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_ONLINE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Online</a></li>
--   <li><i>AGENTS_STAFFED</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Staffed</a></li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_IN_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>In queue</a></li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_SCHEDULED</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Scheduled</a></li>
--   <li><i>OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE</i> Unit: SECONDSWhen you use groupings,
--   Unit says SECONDS and the Value is returned in SECONDS.When you do not
--   use groupings, Unit says SECONDS but the Value is returned in
--   MILLISECONDS. For example, if you get a response like this:<tt>{
--   "Metric": { "Name": "OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE", "Unit": "SECONDS" },
--   "Value": 24113.0 </tt>}The actual OLDEST_CONTACT_AGE is 24
--   seconds.Name in real-time metrics report: <a>Oldest</a></li>
--   <li><i>SLOTS_ACTIVE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics report:
--   <a>Active</a></li>
--   <li><i>SLOTS_AVAILABLE</i> Unit: COUNTName in real-time metrics
--   report: <a>Availability</a></li>
--   </ul>

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartOutboundVoiceContact</a> smart constructor.
data StartOutboundVoiceContact
StartOutboundVoiceContact' :: Maybe AnswerMachineDetectionConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe TrafficType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StartOutboundVoiceContact

-- | Create a value of <a>StartOutboundVoiceContact</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:answerMachineDetectionConfig:StartOutboundVoiceContact'</a>,
--   <a>startOutboundVoiceContact_answerMachineDetectionConfig</a> -
--   Configuration of the answering machine detection for this outbound
--   call.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queueId:StartOutboundVoiceContact'</a>,
--   <a>startOutboundVoiceContact_queueId</a> - The queue for the call. If
--   you specify a queue, the phone displayed for caller ID is the phone
--   number specified in the queue. If you do not specify a queue, the
--   queue defined in the contact flow is used. If you do not specify a
--   queue, you must specify a source phone number.
--   
--   <a>$sel:campaignId:StartOutboundVoiceContact'</a>,
--   <a>startOutboundVoiceContact_campaignId</a> - The campaign identifier
--   of the outbound communication.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trafficType:StartOutboundVoiceContact'</a>,
--   <a>startOutboundVoiceContact_trafficType</a> - Denotes the class of
--   traffic. Calls with different traffic types are handled differently by
--   Amazon Connect. The default value is <tt>GENERAL</tt>. Use
--   <tt>CAMPAIGN</tt> if <tt>EnableAnswerMachineDetection</tt> is set to
--   <tt>true</tt>. For all other cases, use <tt>GENERAL</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourcePhoneNumber:StartOutboundVoiceContact'</a>,
--   <a>startOutboundVoiceContact_sourcePhoneNumber</a> - The phone number
--   associated with the Amazon Connect instance, in E.164 format. If you
--   do not specify a source phone number, you must specify a queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attributes:StartOutboundVoiceContact'</a>,
--   <a>startOutboundVoiceContact_attributes</a> - A custom key-value pair
--   using an attribute map. The attributes are standard Amazon Connect
--   attributes, and can be accessed in contact flows just like any other
--   contact attributes.
--   
--   There can be up to 32,768 UTF-8 bytes across all key-value pairs per
--   contact. Attribute keys can include only alphanumeric, dash, and
--   underscore characters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:StartOutboundVoiceContact'</a>,
--   <a>startOutboundVoiceContact_clientToken</a> - A unique,
--   case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency
--   of the request. The token is valid for 7 days after creation. If a
--   contact is already started, the contact ID is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationPhoneNumber:StartOutboundVoiceContact'</a>,
--   <a>startOutboundVoiceContact_destinationPhoneNumber</a> - The phone
--   number of the customer, in E.164 format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactFlowId:StartOutboundVoiceContact'</a>,
--   <a>startOutboundVoiceContact_contactFlowId</a> - The identifier of the
--   contact flow for the outbound call. To see the ContactFlowId in the
--   Amazon Connect console user interface, on the navigation menu go to
--   <b>Routing</b>, <b>Contact Flows</b>. Choose the contact flow. On the
--   contact flow page, under the name of the contact flow, choose <b>Show
--   additional flow information</b>. The ContactFlowId is the last part of
--   the ARN, shown here in bold:
--   
--   
--   arn:aws:connect:us-west-2:xxxxxxxxxxxx:instance/xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx/contact-flow/<b>846ec553-a005-41c0-8341-xxxxxxxxxxxx</b>
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:StartOutboundVoiceContact'</a>,
--   <a>startOutboundVoiceContact_instanceId</a> - The identifier of the
--   Amazon Connect instance. You can find the instanceId in the ARN of the
--   instance.
newStartOutboundVoiceContact :: Text -> Text -> Text -> StartOutboundVoiceContact

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetMetricData</a> smart constructor.
data GetMetricData
GetMetricData' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Grouping] -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> Filters -> [HistoricalMetric] -> GetMetricData

-- | Create a value of <a>GetMetricData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_nextToken</a> -
--   The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupings:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_groupings</a> -
--   The grouping applied to the metrics returned. For example, when
--   results are grouped by queue, the metrics returned are grouped by
--   queue. The values returned apply to the metrics for each queue rather
--   than aggregated for all queues.
--   
--   If no grouping is specified, a summary of metrics for all queues is
--   returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_maxResults</a>
--   - The maximum number of results to return per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceId:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_instanceId</a>
--   - The identifier of the Amazon Connect instance. You can find the
--   instanceId in the ARN of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_startTime</a> -
--   The timestamp, in UNIX Epoch time format, at which to start the
--   reporting interval for the retrieval of historical metrics data. The
--   time must be specified using a multiple of 5 minutes, such as 10:05,
--   10:10, 10:15.
--   
--   The start time cannot be earlier than 24 hours before the time of the
--   request. Historical metrics are available only for 24 hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_endTime</a> - The
--   timestamp, in UNIX Epoch time format, at which to end the reporting
--   interval for the retrieval of historical metrics data. The time must
--   be specified using an interval of 5 minutes, such as 11:00, 11:05,
--   11:10, and must be later than the start time timestamp.
--   
--   The time range between the start and end time must be less than 24
--   hours.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:GetMetricData'</a>, <a>getMetricData_filters</a> - The
--   queues, up to 100, or channels, to use to filter the metrics returned.
--   Metric data is retrieved only for the resources associated with the
--   queues or channels included in the filter. You can include both queue
--   IDs and queue ARNs in the same request. VOICE, CHAT, and TASK channels
--   are supported.
--   
--   To filter by <tt>Queues</tt>, enter the queue ID/ARN, not the name of
--   the queue.
--   
--   <a>$sel:historicalMetrics:GetMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getMetricData_historicalMetrics</a> - The metrics to retrieve.
--   Specify the name, unit, and statistic for each metric. The following
--   historical metrics are available. For a description of each metric,
--   see <a>Historical Metrics Definitions</a> in the <i>Amazon Connect
--   Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   This API does not support a contacts incoming metric (there's no
--   CONTACTS_INCOMING metric missing from the documented list).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i>ABANDON_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>AFTER_CONTACT_WORK_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>API_CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CALLBACK_CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_ABANDONED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_AGENT_HUNG_UP_FIRST</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_CONSULTED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED_INCOMING</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HANDLED_OUTBOUND</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_HOLD_ABANDONS</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_MISSED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_QUEUED</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_IN</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_IN_FROM_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic:
--   SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_OUT</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic: SUM</li>
--   <li><i>CONTACTS_TRANSFERRED_OUT_FROM_QUEUE</i> Unit: COUNTStatistic:
--   SUM</li>
--   <li><i>HANDLE_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>HOLD_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>INTERACTION_AND_HOLD_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>INTERACTION_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>OCCUPANCY</i> Unit: PERCENTStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>QUEUE_ANSWER_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: AVG</li>
--   <li><i>QUEUED_TIME</i> Unit: SECONDSStatistic: MAX</li>
--   <li><i>SERVICE_LEVEL</i> You can include up to 20 SERVICE_LEVEL
--   metrics in a request.Unit: PERCENTStatistic: AVGThreshold: For
--   <tt>ThresholdValue</tt>, enter any whole number from 1 to 604800
--   (inclusive), in seconds. For <tt>Comparison</tt>, you must enter
--   <tt>LT</tt> (for "Less than").</li>
--   </ul>
newGetMetricData :: Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> Filters -> GetMetricData

-- | Create a value of <a>GetMetricDataResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getMetricDataResponse_nextToken</a> - If there are additional
--   results, this is the token for the next set of results.
--   
--   The token expires after 5 minutes from the time it is created.
--   Subsequent requests that use the token must use the same request
--   parameters as the request that generated the token.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricResults:GetMetricDataResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getMetricDataResponse_metricResults</a> - Information about the
--   historical metrics.
--   
--   If no grouping is specified, a summary of metric data is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetMetricDataResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getMetricDataResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetMetricDataResponse :: Int -> GetMetricDataResponse

-- | Contains information about an agent status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAgentStatus</a> smart constructor.
data AgentStatus
AgentStatus' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AgentStatusState -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AgentStatusType -> AgentStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>AgentStatus</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:displayOrder:AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_displayOrder</a>
--   - The display order of the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentStatusId:AgentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>agentStatus_agentStatusId</a> - The identifier of the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_name</a> - The name of
--   the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_state</a> - The state
--   of the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_tags</a> - One or more
--   tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_description</a> -
--   The description of the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:agentStatusARN:AgentStatus'</a>,
--   <a>agentStatus_agentStatusARN</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the agent status.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':AgentStatus'</a>, <a>agentStatus_type</a> - The type of
--   agent status.
newAgentStatus :: AgentStatus

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAgentStatusSummary</a> smart constructor.

AgentStatusSummary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AgentStatusType -> AgentStatusSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>AgentStatusSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   identifier for an agent status.
--

--   The name of the agent status.
--

--   - The type of the agent status.
newAgentStatusSummary :: AgentStatusSummary

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

newContactFlow :: ContactFlow

-- | Contains credentials to use for federation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCredentials</a> smart constructor.
data Credentials
Credentials' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Credentials

-- | Create a value of <a>Credentials</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshTokenExpiration:Credentials'</a>,
--   <a>credentials_refreshTokenExpiration</a> - Renews the expiration
--   timer for a generated token.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessToken:Credentials'</a>, <a>credentials_accessToken</a> -
--   An access token generated for a federated user to access Amazon
--   Connect.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessTokenExpiration:Credentials'</a>,
--   <a>credentials_accessTokenExpiration</a> - A token generated with an
--   expiration time for the session a user is logged in to Amazon Connect.
--   
--   <a>$sel:refreshToken:Credentials'</a>, <a>credentials_refreshToken</a>
--   - Renews a token generated for a user to access the Amazon Connect
--   instance.
newCredentials :: Credentials

-- | Contains information about a real-time metric. For a description of
--   each metric, see <a>Real-time Metrics Definitions</a> in the <i>Amazon
--   Connect Administrator Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCurrentMetric</a> smart constructor.
data CurrentMetric
CurrentMetric' :: Maybe Unit -> Maybe CurrentMetricName -> CurrentMetric

-- | Create a value of <a>CurrentMetric</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:CurrentMetric'</a>, <a>currentMetric_unit</a> - The unit
--   for the metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CurrentMetric'</a>, <a>currentMetric_name</a> - The name
--   of the metric.
newCurrentMetric :: CurrentMetric

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCurrentMetricData</a> smart constructor.
data CurrentMetricData
CurrentMetricData' :: Maybe CurrentMetric -> Maybe Double -> CurrentMetricData

-- | Create a value of <a>CurrentMetricData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:CurrentMetricData'</a>, <a>currentMetricData_metric</a>
--   - Information about the metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:CurrentMetricData'</a>, <a>currentMetricData_value</a> -
--   The value of the metric.
newCurrentMetricData :: CurrentMetricData

-- | Contains information about a set of real-time metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCurrentMetricResult</a> smart constructor.
data CurrentMetricResult
CurrentMetricResult' :: Maybe [CurrentMetricData] -> Maybe Dimensions -> CurrentMetricResult

-- | Create a value of <a>CurrentMetricResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:collections:CurrentMetricResult'</a>,
--   <a>currentMetricResult_collections</a> - The set of metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:CurrentMetricResult'</a>,
--   <a>currentMetricResult_dimensions</a> - The dimensions for the
--   metrics.
newCurrentMetricResult :: CurrentMetricResult

-- | Contains information about the dimensions for a set of metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDimensions</a> smart constructor.
data Dimensions
Dimensions' :: Maybe QueueReference -> Maybe Channel -> Dimensions

-- | Create a value of <a>Dimensions</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:queue:Dimensions'</a>, <a>dimensions_queue</a> - Information
--   about the queue for which metrics are returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:channel:Dimensions'</a>, <a>dimensions_channel</a> - The
--   channel used for grouping and filters.
newDimensions :: Dimensions

-- | The encryption configuration.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEncryptionConfig</a> smart constructor.
data EncryptionConfig
EncryptionConfig' :: EncryptionType -> Text -> EncryptionConfig

-- | Create a value of <a>EncryptionConfig</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionType:EncryptionConfig'</a>,
--   <a>encryptionConfig_encryptionType</a> - The type of encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyId:EncryptionConfig'</a>, <a>encryptionConfig_keyId</a> -
--   The full ARN of the encryption key.
--   
--   Be sure to provide the full ARN of the encryption key, not just the
--   ID.
newEncryptionConfig :: EncryptionType -> Text -> EncryptionConfig

-- | Contains the filter to apply when retrieving metrics.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFilters</a> smart constructor.
data Filters
Filters' :: Maybe [Channel] -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Filters

-- | Create a value of <a>Filters</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channels:Filters'</a>, <a>filters_channels</a> - The channel
--   to use to filter the metrics.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queues:Filters'</a>, <a>filters_queues</a> - The queues to use
--   to filter the metrics. You can specify up to 100 queues per request.
newFilters :: Filters

-- | Contains information about which channels are supported, and how many
--   contacts an agent can have on a channel simultaneously.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMediaConcurrency</a> smart constructor.
data MediaConcurrency
MediaConcurrency' :: Channel -> Natural -> MediaConcurrency

-- | Create a value of <a>MediaConcurrency</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:channel:MediaConcurrency'</a>, <a>mediaConcurrency_channel</a>
--   - The channels that agents can handle in the Contact Control Panel
--   (CCP).
--   
--   <a>$sel:concurrency:MediaConcurrency'</a>,
--   <a>mediaConcurrency_concurrency</a> - The number of contacts an agent
--   can have on a channel simultaneously.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>VOICE</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   1.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>CHAT</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
--   
--   Valid Range for <tt>TASK</tt>: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of
--   10.
newMediaConcurrency :: Channel -> Natural -> MediaConcurrency

--   connect. In the Amazon Connect console, when you create a quick
--   connect, you are prompted to assign one of the following types: Agent
--   (USER), External (PHONE_NUMBER), or Queue (QUEUE).

-- | Create a value of <a>S3Config</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:encryptionConfig:S3Config'</a>,
--   <a>s3Config_encryptionConfig</a> - The Amazon S3 encryption
--   configuration.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:S3Config'</a>, <a>s3Config_bucketName</a> - The S3
--   bucket name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketPrefix:S3Config'</a>, <a>s3Config_bucketPrefix</a> - The
--   S3 bucket prefix.
newS3Config :: Text -> Text -> S3Config

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   - The threshold value to compare.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparison:Threshold'</a>, <a>threshold_comparison</a> - The
--   type of comparison. Only "less than" (LT) comparisons are supported.
newThreshold :: Threshold

-- | Contains information about a user account for a Amazon Connect
--   instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUser</a> smart constructor.
data User
User' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Maybe UserIdentityInfo -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe UserPhoneConfig -> Maybe Text -> User

-- | Create a value of <a>User</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:securityProfileIds:User'</a>, <a>user_securityProfileIds</a> -
--   The identifiers of the security profiles for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identityInfo:User'</a>, <a>user_identityInfo</a> - Information
--   about the user identity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:User'</a>, <a>user_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the user account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:User'</a>, <a>user_id</a> - The identifier of the user
--   account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hierarchyGroupId:User'</a>, <a>user_hierarchyGroupId</a> - The
--   identifier of the hierarchy group for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:directoryUserId:User'</a>, <a>user_directoryUserId</a> - The
--   identifier of the user account in the directory used for identity
--   management.
--   
--   <a>$sel:routingProfileId:User'</a>, <a>user_routingProfileId</a> - The
--   identifier of the routing profile for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:User'</a>, <a>user_tags</a> - The tags.
--   
--   <a>$sel:phoneConfig:User'</a>, <a>user_phoneConfig</a> - Information
--   about the phone configuration for the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:User'</a>, <a>user_username</a> - The user name
--   assigned to the user account.
newUser :: User

--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserIdentityInfo</a> smart constructor.
data UserIdentityInfo
UserIdentityInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> UserIdentityInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>UserIdentityInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:email:UserIdentityInfo'</a>, <a>userIdentityInfo_email</a> -
--   The email address. If you are using SAML for identity management and
--   include this parameter, an error is returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastName:UserIdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>userIdentityInfo_lastName</a> - The last name. This is required if
--   you are using Amazon Connect or SAML for identity management.
--   
--   <a>$sel:firstName:UserIdentityInfo'</a>,
--   <a>userIdentityInfo_firstName</a> - The first name. This is required
--   if you are using Amazon Connect or SAML for identity management.
newUserIdentityInfo :: UserIdentityInfo

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>userPhoneConfig_autoAccept</a> - The Auto accept setting.
--   
--   <a>$sel:afterContactWorkTimeLimit:UserPhoneConfig'</a>,
--   <a>userPhoneConfig_afterContactWorkTimeLimit</a> - The After Call Work
--   (ACW) timeout setting, in seconds.
--   
--   <a>$sel:deskPhoneNumber:UserPhoneConfig'</a>,
--   <a>userPhoneConfig_deskPhoneNumber</a> - The phone number for the
--   user's desk phone.
--

--   <a>userPhoneConfig_phoneType</a> - The phone type.
newUserPhoneConfig :: PhoneType -> UserPhoneConfig
